3371        return self.fig
3372
3373def plot_data_from_db(settings):
3374    from .io import _read_db, _read_and_merge_data
3375    from .utils import annotate_conditions, save_settings
3376    """
3377    Extracts the specified table from the SQLite database and plots a specified column.
3378
3379    Args:
3380        db_path (str): The path to the SQLite database.
3381        table_names (str): The name of the table to extract.
3382        data_column (str): The column to plot from the table.
3383
3384    Returns:
3385        df (pd.DataFrame): The extracted table as a DataFrame.
3386    """
3387
3388
3389
3390    if isinstance(settings['src'], str):
3391        srcs = [settings['src']]
3392    elif isinstance(settings['src'], list):
3393        srcs = settings['src']
3394    else:
3395        raise ValueError("src must be a string or a list of strings.")
3396    
3397    if isinstance(settings['database'], str):
3398        settings['database'] = [settings['database'] for _ in range(len(srcs))]
3399    
3400    settings['dst'] = os.path.join(srcs[0], 'results')
3401    
3402    save_settings(settings, name=f"{settings['graph_name']}_plot_settings_db", show=True)
3403
3404    dfs = []
3405    for i, src in enumerate(srcs):
3406
3407        db_loc = os.path.join(src, 'measurements', settings['database'][i])
3408        print(f"Database: {db_loc}")
3409        if settings['table_names'] in ['saliency_image_correlations']:
3410            print(f"Database table: {settings['table_names']}")
3411            [df1] = _read_db(db_loc, tables=[settings['table_names']])
3412        else:
3413            df1, _ = _read_and_merge_data(locs=[db_loc],
3414                                    tables = settings['table_names'],
3415                                    verbose=settings['verbose'],
3416                                    nuclei_limit=settings['nuclei_limit'],
3417                                    pathogen_limit=settings['pathogen_limit'])
3418     
3419        dft = annotate_conditions(df1, 
3420                                cells=settings['cell_types'], 
3421                                cell_loc=settings['cell_plate_metadata'], 
3422                                pathogens=settings['pathogen_types'],
3423                                pathogen_loc=settings['pathogen_plate_metadata'],
3424                                treatments=settings['treatments'], 
3425                                treatment_loc=settings['treatment_plate_metadata'])
3426        dfs.append(dft)
3427        
3428    df = pd.concat(dfs, axis=0)
3429    df['prc'] = df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['columnID'].astype(str)
3430    
3431    if settings['cell_plate_metadata'] !=  None:
3432        df = df.dropna(subset='host_cell')
3433
3434    if settings['pathogen_plate_metadata'] !=  None:
3435        df = df.dropna(subset='pathogen')
3436
3437    if settings['treatment_plate_metadata'] !=  None:
3438        df = df.dropna(subset='treatment')
3439
3440    df = df.dropna(subset=settings['data_column'])
3441        
3442    if settings['grouping_column'] not in df.columns:
3443        print(f"Grouping column {settings['grouping_column']} not found in DataFrame.")
3444        print(f'Please use one of the following columns: {df.columns}')
3445        display(df)
3446        return None
3447    
3448    df = df.dropna(subset=settings['grouping_column'])
3449
3450    src = srcs[0] 
3451    dst = os.path.join(src, 'results', settings['graph_name'])
3452    os.makedirs(dst, exist_ok=True)
3453    
3454    spacr_graph = spacrGraph(
3455        df=df,                                       # Your DataFrame
3456        grouping_column=settings['grouping_column'], # Column for grouping the data (x-axis)
3457        data_column=settings['data_column'],         # Column for the data (y-axis)
3458        graph_type=settings['graph_type'],           # Type of plot ('bar', 'box', 'violin', 'jitter')
3459        graph_name=settings['graph_name'],           # Name of the plot
3460        summary_func='mean',                         # Function to summarize data (e.g., 'mean', 'median')
3461        colors=None,                                 # Custom colors for the plot (optional)
3462        output_dir=dst,                              # Directory to save the plot and results
3463        save=settings['save'],                       # Whether to save the plot and results
3464        y_lim=settings['y_lim'],                     # Starting point for y-axis (optional)
3465        error_bar_type='std',                        # Type of error bar ('std' or 'sem')
3466        representation=settings['representation'],
3467        theme=settings['theme'],                     # Seaborn color palette theme (e.g., 'pastel', 'muted')
3468    )
3469
3470    # Create the plot
3471    spacr_graph.create_plot()
3472
3473    # Get the figure object if needed
3474    fig = spacr_graph.get_figure()
3475    plt.show()
3476
3477    # Optional: Get the results DataFrame containing statistical test results
3478    results_df = spacr_graph.get_results()
3479    return fig, results_df
3480
3481def plot_data_from_csv(settings):
3482    from .io import _read_db, _read_and_merge_data
3483    from .utils import annotate_conditions, save_settings
3484    """
3485    Extracts the specified table from the SQLite database and plots a specified column.
3486
3487    Args:
3488        db_path (str): The path to the SQLite database.
3489        table_names (str): The name of the table to extract.
3490        data_column (str): The column to plot from the table.
3491
3492    Returns:
3493        df (pd.DataFrame): The extracted table as a DataFrame.
3494    """
3495
3496    if isinstance(settings['src'], str):
3497        srcs = [settings['src']]
3498    elif isinstance(settings['src'], list):
3499        srcs = settings['src']
3500    else:
3501        raise ValueError("src must be a string or a list of strings.")
3502    
3503    dfs = []
3504    for i, src in enumerate(srcs):
3505        dft = pd.read_csv(src)
3506        if 'plateID' not in dft.columns:
3507            dft['plateID'] = f"plate{i+1}"
3508            dft['common'] = 'spacr'
3509        dfs.append(dft)
3510
3511    df = pd.concat(dfs, axis=0)
3512    
3513    if 'prc' in df.columns:
3514        # Check if 'plateID', 'rowID', and 'columnID' are all missing from df.columns
3515        if not all(col in df.columns for col in ['plate', 'rowID', 'columnID']):
3516            try:
3517                # Split 'prc' into 'plateID', 'rowID', and 'columnID'
3518                df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID']] = df['prc'].str.split('_', expand=True)
3519            except Exception as e:
3520                print(f"Could not split the prc column: {e}")
3521
3522                
3523    display(df)
3524
3525    df = df.dropna(subset=settings['data_column'])
3526    df = df.dropna(subset=settings['grouping_column'])
3527    src = srcs[0] 
3528    dst = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(src), 'results', settings['graph_name'])
3529    os.makedirs(dst, exist_ok=True)
3530    
3531    spacr_graph = spacrGraph(
3532        df=df,                                       # Your DataFrame
3533        grouping_column=settings['grouping_column'], # Column for grouping the data (x-axis)
3534        data_column=settings['data_column'],         # Column for the data (y-axis)
3535        graph_type=settings['graph_type'],           # Type of plot ('bar', 'box', 'violin', 'jitter')
3536        graph_name=settings['graph_name'],           # Name of the plot
3537        summary_func='mean',                         # Function to summarize data (e.g., 'mean', 'median')
3538        colors=None,                                 # Custom colors for the plot (optional)
3539        output_dir=dst,                              # Directory to save the plot and results
3540        save=settings['save'],                       # Whether to save the plot and results
3541        y_lim=settings['y_lim'],                     # Starting point for y-axis (optional)
3542        log_y=settings['log_y'],                     # Log-transform the y-axis
3543        log_x=settings['log_x'],                     # Log-transform the x-axis
3544        error_bar_type='std',                        # Type of error bar ('std' or 'sem')
3545        representation=settings['representation'],
3546        theme=settings['theme'],                     # Seaborn color palette theme (e.g., 'pastel', 'muted')
3547    )
3548
3549    # Create the plot
3550    spacr_graph.create_plot()
3551
3552    # Get the figure object if needed
3553    fig = spacr_graph.get_figure()
3554    plt.show()
3555
3556    # Optional: Get the results DataFrame containing statistical test results
3557    results_df = spacr_graph.get_results()
3558    return fig, results_df
3559
3560def plot_region(settings):
3561
3562    def _sort_paths_by_basename(paths):
3563        return sorted(paths, key=lambda path: os.path.basename(path))
3564    
3565    def save_figure_as_pdf(fig, path):
3566        os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(path), exist_ok=True)  # Create directory if it doesn't exist
3567        fig.savefig(path, format='pdf', dpi=600, bbox_inches='tight')
3568        print(f"Saved {path}")
3569
3570    from .io import _read_db
3571    from .utils import correct_paths
3572    fov_path = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'merged', settings['name'])
3573    name = os.path.splitext(settings['name'])[0]
3574    
3575    db_path = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'measurements', 'measurements.db')
3576    paths_df = _read_db(db_path, tables=['png_list'])[0]
3577    paths_df, _ = correct_paths(df=paths_df, base_path=settings['src'], folder='data')
3578    paths_df = paths_df[paths_df['png_path'].str.contains(name, na=False)]
3579
3580    activation_mode = f"{settings['activation_mode']}_list"
3581    activation_db_path = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'measurements', settings['activation_db'])
3582    activation_paths_df = _read_db(activation_db_path, tables=[activation_mode])[0]
3583    activation_db = os.path.splitext(settings['activation_db'])[0]
3584    base_path=os.path.join(settings['src'], 'datasets',activation_db) 
3585    activation_paths_df, _ = correct_paths(df=activation_paths_df, base_path=base_path, folder=settings['activation_mode'])
3586    activation_paths_df = activation_paths_df[activation_paths_df['png_path'].str.contains(name, na=False)]
3587
3588    png_paths = _sort_paths_by_basename(paths_df['png_path'].tolist())
3589    activation_paths = _sort_paths_by_basename(activation_paths_df['png_path'].tolist())
3590
3591    
3592    if activation_paths:
3593        fig_3 = plot_image_grid(image_paths=activation_paths, percentiles=settings['percentiles'])
3594    else:
3595        fig_3 = None
3596        print(f"Could not find any cropped PNGs")
3597    if png_paths:
3598        fig_2 = plot_image_grid(image_paths=png_paths, percentiles=settings['percentiles'])
3599    else:
3600        fig_2 = None
3601        print(f"Could not find any activation maps")
3602    
3603    print('fov_path', fov_path)
3604    fig_1 = plot_image_mask_overlay(file=fov_path,
3605                                    channels=settings['channels'],
3606                                    cell_channel=settings['cell_channel'],
3607                                    nucleus_channel=settings['nucleus_channel'],
3608                                    pathogen_channel=settings['pathogen_channel'],
3609                                    figuresize=10,
3610                                    percentiles=settings['percentiles'],
3611                                    thickness=3, 
3612                                    save_pdf=True, 
3613                                    mode=settings['mode'],
3614                                    export_tiffs=settings['export_tiffs'])
3615    
3616    dst = os.path.join(settings['src'], 'results', name)
3617    
3618    if not fig_1 == None:
3619        save_figure_as_pdf(fig_1, os.path.join(dst, f"{name}_mask_overlay.pdf"))
3620    if not fig_2 == None:
3621        save_figure_as_pdf(fig_2, os.path.join(dst, f"{name}_png_grid.pdf"))
3622    if not fig_3 == None:
3623        save_figure_as_pdf(fig_3, os.path.join(dst, f"{name}_activation_grid.pdf"))
3624    
3625    return fig_1, fig_2, fig_3
3626
3627def plot_image_grid(image_paths, percentiles):
3628    """
3629    Plots a square grid of images from a list of image paths. 
3630    Unused subplots are filled with black, and padding is minimized.
3631
3632    Parameters:
3633    - image_paths: List of paths to images to be displayed.
3634
3635    Returns:
3636    - fig: The generated matplotlib figure.
3637    """
3638
3639    from PIL import Image
3640    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
3641    import math
3642
3643    def _normalize_image(image, percentiles=(2, 98)):
3644        """ Normalize the image to the given percentiles for each channel independently, preserving the input type (either PIL.Image or numpy.ndarray)."""
3645        
3646        # Check if the input is a PIL image and convert it to a NumPy array
3647        is_pil_image = isinstance(image, Image.Image)
3648        if is_pil_image:
3649            image = np.array(image)
3650
3651        # If the image is single-channel, normalize directly
3652        if image.ndim == 2:
3653            v_min, v_max = np.percentile(image, percentiles)
3654            normalized_image = np.clip((image - v_min) / (v_max - v_min), 0, 1)
3655        else:
3656            # If multi-channel, normalize each channel independently
3657            normalized_image = np.zeros_like(image, dtype=np.float32)
3658            for c in range(image.shape[-1]):
3659                v_min, v_max = np.percentile(image[..., c], percentiles)
3660                normalized_image[..., c] = np.clip((image[..., c] - v_min) / (v_max - v_min), 0, 1)
3661
3662        # If the input was a PIL image, convert the result back to PIL format
3663        if is_pil_image:
3664            # Ensure the image is converted back to 8-bit range (0-255) for PIL
3665            normalized_image = (normalized_image * 255).astype(np.uint8)
3666            return Image.fromarray(normalized_image)
3667
3668        return normalized_image
3669
3670    N = len(image_paths)
3671    # Calculate the smallest square grid size to fit all images
3672    grid_size = math.ceil(math.sqrt(N))  
3673
3674    # Create the square grid of subplots with a black background
3675    fig, axs = plt.subplots(
3676        grid_size, grid_size, 
3677        figsize=(grid_size * 2, grid_size * 2),
3678        facecolor='black'  # Set figure background to black
3679    )
3680
3681    # Flatten axs in case of a 2D array
3682    axs = axs.flatten()
3683
3684    for i, img_path in enumerate(image_paths):
3685        ax = axs[i]
3686
3687        # Load the image
3688        img = Image.open(img_path)
3689        img = _normalize_image(img, percentiles)
3690
3691        # Display the image
3692        ax.imshow(img)
3693        ax.axis('off')  # Hide axes
3694
3695    # Fill any unused subplots with black
3696    for j in range(i + 1, len(axs)):
3697        axs[j].imshow([[0, 0, 0]], cmap='gray')  # Black square
3698        axs[j].axis('off')  # Hide axes
3699
3700    # Adjust layout to minimize white space
3701    plt.subplots_adjust(wspace=0, hspace=0, left=0, right=1, top=1, bottom=0)
3702
3703    return fig
3704
3705def overlay_masks_on_images(img_folder, normalize=True, resize=True, save=False, plot=False, thickness=2):
3706    """
3707    Load images and masks from folders, overlay mask contours on images, and optionally normalize, resize, and save.
3708
3709    Args:
3710        img_folder (str): Path to the folder containing images.
3711        mask_folder (str): Path to the folder containing masks.
3712        normalize (bool): If True, normalize images to the 1st and 99th percentiles.
3713        resize (bool): If True, resize the final overlay to 500x500.
3714        save (bool): If True, save the final overlay in an 'overlay' folder within the image folder.
3715        thickness (int): Thickness of the contour lines.
3716    """
3717
3718    def normalize_image(image):
3719        """Normalize the image to the 1st and 99th percentiles."""
3720        lower, upper = np.percentile(image, [1, 99])
3721        image = np.clip((image - lower) / (upper - lower), 0, 1)
3722        return (image * 255).astype(np.uint8)
3723
3724    
3725    mask_folder = os.path.join(img_folder,'masks')    
3726    overlay_folder = os.path.join(img_folder, "overlay")
3727    if save and not os.path.exists(overlay_folder):
3728        os.makedirs(overlay_folder)
3729
3730    # Get common filenames in both image and mask folders
3731    image_filenames = set(os.listdir(img_folder))
3732    mask_filenames = set(os.listdir(mask_folder))
3733    common_filenames = image_filenames.intersection(mask_filenames)
3734
3735    if not common_filenames:
3736        print("No matching filenames found in both folders.")
3737        return
3738
3739    for filename in common_filenames:
3740        # Load image and mask
3741        img_path = os.path.join(img_folder, filename)
3742        mask_path = os.path.join(mask_folder, filename)
3743
3744        image = tiff.imread(img_path)
3745        mask = tiff.imread(mask_path)
3746
3747        # Normalize the image if requested
3748        if normalize:
3749            image = normalize_image(image)
3750
3751        # Ensure the mask is binary
3752        mask = (mask > 0).astype(np.uint8)
3753
3754        # Resize the mask if it doesn't match the image size
3755        if mask.shape != image.shape[:2]:
3756            mask = cv2.resize(mask, (image.shape[1], image.shape[0]), interpolation=cv2.INTER_NEAREST)
3757
3758        # Generate contours from the mask
3759        contours, _ = cv2.findContours(mask, cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
3760
3761        # Convert to RGB if grayscale
3762        if image.ndim == 2:
3763            image_rgb = cv2.cvtColor(image, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
3764        else:
3765            image_rgb = image.copy()
3766            
3767        # Draw contours with alpha blending
3768        overlay = image_rgb.copy()
3769        cv2.drawContours(overlay, contours, -1, (255, 0, 0), thickness)
3770        blended = cv2.addWeighted(overlay, 0.7, image_rgb, 0.3, 0)
3771        
3772        # Resize the final overlay if requested
3773        if resize:
3774            blended = cv2.resize(blended, (1000, 1000), interpolation=cv2.INTER_AREA)
3775
3776        # Save the overlay if requested
3777        if save:
3778            save_path = os.path.join(overlay_folder, filename)
3779            cv2.imwrite(save_path, cv2.cvtColor(blended, cv2.COLOR_RGB2BGR))
3780        
3781        if plot:
3782            # Display the result
3783            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10))
3784            plt.imshow(blended)
3785            plt.title(f"Overlay: {filename}")
3786            plt.axis('off')
3787            plt.show()
3788
3789def graph_importance(settings):
3790    
3791    from .settings import set_graph_importance_defaults
3792    from .utils import save_settings
3793    
3794    if not isinstance(settings['csvs'], list):
3795        settings['csvs'] = settings['csvs']
3796    
3797    settings['src'] = os.path.dirname(settings['csvs'][0])
3798    
3799    settings = set_graph_importance_defaults(settings)
3800    save_settings(settings, name='graph_importance')
3801    
3802    dfs = []
3803    for path in settings['csvs']:
3804        dft = pd.read_csv(path)
3805        dfs.append(dft)
3806
3807    df = pd.concat(dfs)
3808    
3809    if not all(col in df.columns for col in (settings['grouping_column'], settings['data_column'])):
3810        print(f"grouping {settings['grouping_column']} and data {settings['data_column']} columns must be in {df.columns.to_list()}")
3811        return
3812    
3813    output_dir = os.path.dirname(settings['csvs'][0])
3814    
3815    spacr_graph = spacrGraph(
3816        df=df,                                     
3817        grouping_column=settings['grouping_column'],
3818        data_column=settings['data_column'],   
3819        graph_type=settings['graph_type'],   
3820        graph_name=settings['grouping_column'],
3821        summary_func='mean',                         
3822        colors=None,                                
3823        output_dir=output_dir,                              
3824        save=settings['save'],                       
3825        y_lim=None,                     
3826        error_bar_type='std',                       
3827        representation='object',
3828        theme='muted',                    
3829    )
3830
3831    # Create the plot
3832    spacr_graph.create_plot()
3833
3834    # Get the figure object if needed
3835    fig = spacr_graph.get_figure()
3836    plt.show()
3837    
3838def plot_proportion_stacked_bars(settings, df, group_column, bin_column, prc_column='prc', level='object', cmap='viridis'):
3839    """
3840    Generate a stacked bar plot for proportions and perform chi-squared and pairwise tests.
3841    
3842    Parameters:
3843    - settings (dict): Analysis settings.
3844    - df (DataFrame): Input data.
3845    - group_column (str): Column indicating the groups.
3846    - bin_column (str): Column indicating the categories.
3847    - prc_column (str): Optional; column for additional stratification.
3848    - level (str): Level of aggregation ('well' or 'object').
3849    
3850    Returns:
3851    - chi2 (float): Chi-squared statistic for the overall test.
3852    - p (float): p-value for the overall chi-squared test.
3853    - dof (int): Degrees of freedom for the overall chi-squared test.
3854    - expected (ndarray): Expected frequencies for the overall chi-squared test.
3855    - raw_counts (DataFrame): Contingency table of observed counts.
3856    - fig (Figure): The generated plot.
3857    - pairwise_results (list): Pairwise test results from `chi_pairwise`.
3858    """
3859    
3860    from .sp_stats import chi_pairwise
3861    
3862    # Calculate contingency table for overall chi-squared test
3863    raw_counts = df.groupby([group_column, bin_column]).size().unstack(fill_value=0)
3864    chi2, p, dof, expected = chi2_contingency(raw_counts)
3865    print(f"Chi-squared test statistic (raw data): {chi2:.4f}")
3866    print(f"p-value (raw data): {p:.4e}")
3867
3868    # Perform pairwise comparisons
3869    pairwise_results = chi_pairwise(raw_counts, verbose=settings.get('verbose', False))
3870
3871    # Plot based on level setting
3872    if level in ['well', 'plateID']:
3873        # Aggregate by well for mean  SD visualization
3874        well_proportions = (
3875            df.groupby([group_column, prc_column, bin_column])
3876            .size()
3877            .groupby(level=[0, 1])
3878            .apply(lambda x: x / x.sum())
3879            .unstack(fill_value=0)
3880        )
3881        mean_proportions = well_proportions.groupby(group_column).mean()
3882        std_proportions = well_proportions.groupby(group_column).std()
3883
3884        ax = mean_proportions.plot(
3885            kind='bar', stacked=True, yerr=std_proportions, capsize=5, colormap=cmap, figsize=(12, 8)
3886        )
3887        plt.title('Proportion of Volume Bins by Group (Mean  SD across wells)')
3888    else:
3889        # Object-level plotting without aggregation
3890        group_counts = df.groupby([group_column, bin_column]).size()
3891        group_totals = group_counts.groupby(level=0).sum()
3892        proportions = group_counts / group_totals
3893        proportion_df = proportions.unstack(fill_value=0)
3894
3895        ax = proportion_df.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True, colormap=cmap, figsize=(12, 8))
3896        plt.title('Proportion of Volume Bins by Group')
3897
3898    plt.xlabel('Group')
3899    plt.ylabel('Proportion')
3900
3901    # Update legend with formatted labels, maintaining correct order
3902    plt.legend(title=f'Classes', bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc='upper left')
3903    plt.ylim(0, 1)
3904    fig = plt.gcf()
3905    
3906    results_df = pd.DataFrame({
3907        'chi_squared_stat': [chi2],
3908        'p_value': [p],
3909        'degrees_of_freedom': [dof]
3910    })
3911
3912    return results_df, pairwise_results, fig
3913
3914def create_venn_diagram(file1, file2, gene_column="gene", filter_coeff=0.1, save=True, save_path=None):
3915    """
3916    Reads two CSV files, extracts the `gene` column, and creates a Venn diagram
3917    to show overlapping and non-overlapping genes.
3918
3919    Parameters:
3920        file1 (str): Path to the first CSV file.
3921        file2 (str): Path to the second CSV file.
3922        gene_column (str): Name of the column containing gene data (default: "gene").
3923        filter_coeff (float): Coefficient threshold for filtering genes.
3924        save (bool): Whether to save the plot.
3925        save_path (str): Path to save the Venn diagram figure.
3926
3927    Returns:
3928        dict: Overlapping and non-overlapping genes.
3929    """
3930    # Read CSV files
3931    df1 = pd.read_csv(file1)
3932    df2 = pd.read_csv(file2)
3933
3934    # Filter based on coefficient
3935    if filter_coeff is not None:
3936        df1 = df1[df1['coefficient'] > filter_coeff] if filter_coeff >= 0 else df1[df1['coefficient'] < filter_coeff]
3937        df2 = df2[df2['coefficient'] > filter_coeff] if filter_coeff >= 0 else df2[df2['coefficient'] < filter_coeff]
3938
3939    # Extract gene columns and drop NaN values
3940    genes1 = set(df1[gene_column].dropna())
3941    genes2 = set(df2[gene_column].dropna())
3942
3943    # Calculate overlapping and non-overlapping genes
3944    overlapping_genes = genes1.intersection(genes2)
3945    unique_to_file1 = genes1.difference(genes2)
3946    unique_to_file2 = genes2.difference(genes1)
3947
3948    # Create a Venn diagram
3949    plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
3950    venn = venn2([genes1, genes2], ('File 1 Genes', 'File 2 Genes'))
3951    plt.title("Venn Diagram of Overlapping Genes")
3952
3953    # Save or show the figure
3954    if save:
3955        if save_path is None:
3956            raise ValueError("save_path must be provided when save=True.")
3957        plt.savefig(save_path, dpi=300, bbox_inches="tight", format='pdf')
3958        print(f"Venn diagram saved to {save_path}")
3959    else:
3960        plt.show()
3961
3962    # Return the results
3963    return {
3964        "overlap": list(overlapping_genes),
3965        "unique_to_file1": list(unique_to_file1),
3966        "unique_to_file2": list(unique_to_file2)
3967    }
def plot_image_mask_overlay( file, channels, cell_channel, nucleus_channel, pathogen_channel, figuresize=10, percentiles=(2, 98), thickness=3, save_pdf=True, mode='outlines', export_tiffs=False, all_on_all=False, all_outlines=False, filter_dict=None): 
 39def plot_image_mask_overlay(
 40    file,
 41    channels,
 42    cell_channel,
 43    nucleus_channel,
 44    pathogen_channel,
 45    figuresize=10,
 46    percentiles=(2, 98),
 47    thickness=3,
 48    save_pdf=True,
 49    mode='outlines',
 50    export_tiffs=False,
 51    all_on_all=False,
 52    all_outlines=False,
 53    filter_dict=None
 54):
 55    """Plot image and mask overlays."""
 56
 57    def random_color_cmap(n_labels, seed=None):
 58        """Generates a random color map for a given number of labels."""
 59        if seed is not None:
 60            np.random.seed(seed)
 61        rand_colors = np.random.rand(n_labels, 3)
 62        rand_colors = np.vstack([[0, 0, 0], rand_colors])  # Ensure background is black
 63        cmap = ListedColormap(rand_colors)
 64        return cmap
 65
 66    def _plot_merged_plot(
 67        image,
 68        outlines,
 69        outline_colors,
 70        figuresize,
 71        thickness,
 72        percentiles,
 73        mode='outlines',
 74        all_on_all=False,
 75        all_outlines=False,
 76        channels=None,
 77        cell_channel=None,
 78        nucleus_channel=None,
 79        pathogen_channel=None,
 80        cell_outlines=None,
 81        nucleus_outlines=None,
 82        pathogen_outlines=None,
 83        save_pdf=True
 84    ):
 85        """Plot the merged plot with overlay, image channels, and masks."""
 86
 87        def _generate_colored_mask(mask, cmap):
 88            """Generate a colored mask using the given colormap."""
 89            mask_norm = mask / (mask.max() + 1e-5)  # Normalize mask
 90            colored_mask = cmap(mask_norm)
 91            colored_mask[..., 3] = np.where(mask > 0, 1, 0)  # Alpha channel
 92            return colored_mask
 93
 94        def _overlay_mask(image, mask):
 95            """Overlay the colored mask onto the original image."""
 96            combined = np.clip(image * (1 - mask[..., 3:]) + mask[..., :3] * mask[..., 3:], 0, 1)
 97            return combined
 98
 99        def _normalize_image(image, percentiles):
100            """Normalize the image based on given percentiles."""
101            v_min, v_max = np.percentile(image, percentiles)
102            image_normalized = np.clip((image - v_min) / (v_max - v_min + 1e-5), 0, 1)
103            return image_normalized
104
105        def _generate_contours(mask):
106            """Generate contours from the mask using OpenCV."""
107            contours, _ = cv2.findContours(
108                mask.astype(np.uint8), cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE
109            )
110            return contours
111
112        def _apply_contours(image, mask, color, thickness):
113            """Apply contours to the image."""
114            unique_labels = np.unique(mask)
115            for label in unique_labels:
116                if label == 0:
117                    continue  # Skip background
118                label_mask = (mask == label).astype(np.uint8)
119                contours = _generate_contours(label_mask)
120                cv2.drawContours(
121                    image, contours, -1, mpl.colors.to_rgb(color), thickness
122                )
123            return image
124
125        num_channels = image.shape[-1]
126        fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, num_channels + 1, figsize=(4 * figuresize, figuresize))
127
128        # Identify channels without associated outlines
129        channels_with_outlines = []
130        if cell_channel is not None:
131            channels_with_outlines.append(cell_channel)
132        if nucleus_channel is not None:
133            channels_with_outlines.append(nucleus_channel)
134        if pathogen_channel is not None:
135            channels_with_outlines.append(pathogen_channel)
136
137        for v in range(num_channels):
138            channel_image = image[..., v]
139            channel_image_normalized = _normalize_image(channel_image, percentiles)
140            channel_image_rgb = np.dstack([channel_image_normalized] * 3)
141
142            current_channel = channels[v]
143
144            if all_on_all:
145                # Apply all outlines to all channels
146                for outline, color in zip(outlines, outline_colors):
147                    if mode == 'outlines':
148                        channel_image_rgb = _apply_contours(
149                            channel_image_rgb, outline, color, thickness
150                        )
151                    else:
152                        cmap = random_color_cmap(int(outline.max() + 1), random.randint(0, 100))
153                        mask = _generate_colored_mask(outline, cmap)
154                        channel_image_rgb = _overlay_mask(channel_image_rgb, mask)
155            elif current_channel in channels_with_outlines:
156                # Apply only the relevant outline to each channel
157                outline = None
158                color = None
159
160                if current_channel == cell_channel and cell_outlines is not None:
161                    outline = cell_outlines
162                elif current_channel == nucleus_channel and nucleus_outlines is not None:
163                    outline = nucleus_outlines
164                elif current_channel == pathogen_channel and pathogen_outlines is not None:
165                    outline = pathogen_outlines
166
167                if outline is not None:
168                    if mode == 'outlines':
169                        # Use magenta color when all_on_all=False
170                        channel_image_rgb = _apply_contours(
171                            channel_image_rgb, outline, '#FF00FF', thickness
172                        )
173                    else:
174                        cmap = random_color_cmap(int(outline.max() + 1), random.randint(0, 100))
175                        mask = _generate_colored_mask(outline, cmap)
176                        channel_image_rgb = _overlay_mask(channel_image_rgb, mask)
177            else:
178                # Channel without associated outlines
179                if all_outlines:
180                    # Apply all outlines with specified colors
181                    for outline, color in zip(outlines, ['blue', 'red', 'green']):
182                        if mode == 'outlines':
183                            channel_image_rgb = _apply_contours(
184                                channel_image_rgb, outline, color, thickness
185                            )
186                        else:
187                            cmap = random_color_cmap(int(outline.max() + 1), random.randint(0, 100))
188                            mask = _generate_colored_mask(outline, cmap)
189                            channel_image_rgb = _overlay_mask(channel_image_rgb, mask)
190
191            ax[v].imshow(channel_image_rgb)
192            ax[v].set_title(f'Image - Channel {current_channel}')
193
194        # Create an image combining all objects filled with colors
195        combined_mask = np.zeros_like(outlines[0])
196        for outline in outlines:
197            combined_mask = np.maximum(combined_mask, outline)
198
199        cmap = random_color_cmap(int(combined_mask.max() + 1), random.randint(0, 100))
200        mask = _generate_colored_mask(combined_mask, cmap)
201        blank_image = np.zeros((*combined_mask.shape, 3))
202        filled_image = _overlay_mask(blank_image, mask)
203
204        ax[-1].imshow(filled_image)
205        ax[-1].set_title('Combined Objects Image')
206
207        plt.tight_layout()
208
209        # Save the figure as a PDF
210        if save_pdf:
211            pdf_dir = os.path.join(
212                os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(file)), 'results', 'overlay'
213            )
214            os.makedirs(pdf_dir, exist_ok=True)
215            pdf_path = os.path.join(
216                pdf_dir, os.path.basename(file).replace('.npy', '.pdf')
217            )
218            fig.savefig(pdf_path, format='pdf')
219
220        plt.show()
221        return fig
222
223    def _save_channels_as_tiff(stack, save_dir, filename):
224        """Save each channel in the stack as a grayscale TIFF."""
225        os.makedirs(save_dir, exist_ok=True)
226        for i in range(stack.shape[-1]):
227            channel = stack[..., i]
228            tiff_path = os.path.join(save_dir, f"{filename}_channel_{i}.tiff")
229            tiff.imwrite(tiff_path, channel.astype(np.uint16), photometric='minisblack')
230            print(f"Saved {tiff_path}")
231
232    def _filter_object(mask, intensity_image, min_max_area=(0, 10000000), min_max_intensity=(0, 65000), type_='object'):
233        """
234        Filter objects in a mask based on their area (size) and mean intensity.
235
236        Args:
237            mask (ndarray): The input mask.
238            intensity_image (ndarray): The corresponding intensity image.
239            min_max_area (tuple): A tuple (min_area, max_area) specifying the minimum and maximum area thresholds.
240            min_max_intensity (tuple): A tuple (min_intensity, max_intensity) specifying the minimum and maximum intensity thresholds.
241
242        Returns:
243            ndarray: The filtered mask.
244        """
245        original_dtype = mask.dtype
246        mask_int = mask.astype(np.int64)
247        intensity_image = intensity_image.astype(np.float64)
248        # Compute properties for each labeled object
249        unique_labels = np.unique(mask_int)
250        unique_labels = unique_labels[unique_labels != 0]  # Exclude background
251        num_objects_before = len(unique_labels)
252
253        # Initialize lists to store area and intensity for each object
254        areas = []
255        mean_intensities = []
256        labels_to_keep = []
257
258        for label in unique_labels:
259            label_mask = (mask_int == label)
260            area = np.sum(label_mask)
261            mean_intensity = np.mean(intensity_image[label_mask])
262
263            areas.append(area)
264            mean_intensities.append(mean_intensity)
265
266            # Check if the object meets both area and intensity criteria
267            if (min_max_area[0] <= area <= min_max_area[1]) and (min_max_intensity[0] <= mean_intensity <= min_max_intensity[1]):
268                labels_to_keep.append(label)
269
270        # Convert lists to numpy arrays for easier computation
271        areas = np.array(areas)
272        mean_intensities = np.array(mean_intensities)
273        num_objects_after = len(labels_to_keep)
274        # Compute average area and intensity before and after filtering
275        avg_area_before = areas.mean() if num_objects_before > 0 else 0
276        avg_intensity_before = mean_intensities.mean() if num_objects_before > 0 else 0
277        areas_after = areas[np.isin(unique_labels, labels_to_keep)]
278        mean_intensities_after = mean_intensities[np.isin(unique_labels, labels_to_keep)]
279        avg_area_after = areas_after.mean() if num_objects_after > 0 else 0
280        avg_intensity_after = mean_intensities_after.mean() if num_objects_after > 0 else 0
281        print(f"Before filtering {type_}: {num_objects_before} objects")
282        print(f"Average area {type_}: {avg_area_before:.2f} pixels, Average intensity: {avg_intensity_before:.2f}")
283        print(f"After filtering {type_}: {num_objects_after} objects")
284        print(f"Average area {type_}: {avg_area_after:.2f} pixels, Average intensity: {avg_intensity_after:.2f}")
285        mask_filtered = np.zeros_like(mask_int)
286        for label in labels_to_keep:
287            mask_filtered[mask_int == label] = label
288        mask_filtered = mask_filtered.astype(original_dtype)
289        return mask_filtered
290
291    stack = np.load(file)
292
293    if export_tiffs:
294        save_dir = os.path.join(
295            os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(file)),
296            'results',
297            os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(file))[0],
298            'tiff'
299        )
300        filename = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(file))[0]
301        _save_channels_as_tiff(stack, save_dir, filename)
302
303    # Convert to float for normalization and ensure correct handling of arrays
304    if stack.dtype in (np.uint16, np.uint8):
305        stack = stack.astype(np.float32)
306
307    image = stack[..., channels]
308    outlines = []
309    outline_colors = []
310
311    # Define variables to hold individual outlines
312    cell_outlines = None
313    nucleus_outlines = None
314    pathogen_outlines = None
315
316    if pathogen_channel is not None:
317        pathogen_mask_dim = -1 
318        pathogen_outlines = np.take(stack, pathogen_mask_dim, axis=2)
319        if not filter_dict is None:
320            pathogen_intensity = np.take(stack, pathogen_channel, axis=2)
321            pathogen_outlines = _filter_object(pathogen_outlines, pathogen_intensity, filter_dict['pathogen'][0], filter_dict['pathogen'][1], type_='pathogen')
322        
323        outlines.append(pathogen_outlines)
324        outline_colors.append('green')  
325
326    if nucleus_channel is not None:
327        nucleus_mask_dim = -2 if pathogen_channel is not None else -1
328        nucleus_outlines = np.take(stack, nucleus_mask_dim, axis=2)
329        if not filter_dict is None:
330            nucleus_intensity = np.take(stack, nucleus_channel, axis=2)
331            nucleus_outlines = _filter_object(nucleus_outlines, nucleus_intensity, filter_dict['nucleus'][0], filter_dict['nucleus'][1], type_='nucleus')
332        outlines.append(nucleus_outlines)
333        outline_colors.append('blue')  
334
335    if cell_channel is not None:
336        if nucleus_channel is not None and pathogen_channel is not None:
337            cell_mask_dim = -3
338        elif nucleus_channel is not None or pathogen_channel is not None:
339            cell_mask_dim = -2
340        else:
341            cell_mask_dim = -1
342        cell_outlines = np.take(stack, cell_mask_dim, axis=2)
343        if not filter_dict is None:
344            cell_intensity = np.take(stack, cell_channel, axis=2)
345            cell_outlines = _filter_object(cell_outlines, cell_intensity, filter_dict['cell'][0], filter_dict['cell'][1], type_='cell')
346        outlines.append(cell_outlines)
347        outline_colors.append('red')
348
349    fig = _plot_merged_plot(
350        image=image,
351        outlines=outlines,
352        outline_colors=outline_colors,
353        figuresize=figuresize,
354        thickness=thickness,
355        percentiles=percentiles,  # Pass percentiles to the plotting function
356        mode=mode,
357        all_on_all=all_on_all,
358        all_outlines=all_outlines,
359        channels=channels,
360        cell_channel=cell_channel,
361        nucleus_channel=nucleus_channel,
362        pathogen_channel=pathogen_channel,
363        cell_outlines=cell_outlines,
364        nucleus_outlines=nucleus_outlines,
365        pathogen_outlines=pathogen_outlines,
366        save_pdf=save_pdf
367    )
368
369    return fig

Plot image and mask overlays.

def plot_masks( batch, masks, flows, cmap='inferno', figuresize=10, nr=1, file_type='.npz', print_object_number=True): 
371def plot_masks(batch, masks, flows, cmap='inferno', figuresize=10, nr=1, file_type='.npz', print_object_number=True):
372    """
373    Plot the masks and flows for a given batch of images.
374
375    Args:
376        batch (numpy.ndarray): The batch of images.
377        masks (list or numpy.ndarray): The masks corresponding to the images.
378        flows (list or numpy.ndarray): The flows corresponding to the images.
379        cmap (str, optional): The colormap to use for displaying the images. Defaults to 'inferno'.
380        figuresize (int, optional): The size of the figure. Defaults to 20.
381        nr (int, optional): The maximum number of images to plot. Defaults to 1.
382        file_type (str, optional): The file type of the flows. Defaults to '.npz'.
383        print_object_number (bool, optional): Whether to print the object number on the mask. Defaults to True.
384
385    Returns:
386        None
387    """
388    if len(batch.shape) == 3:
389        batch = np.expand_dims(batch, axis=0)
390    if not isinstance(masks, list):
391        masks = [masks]
392    if not isinstance(flows, list):
393        flows = [flows]
394    else:
395        flows = flows[0]
396    if file_type == 'png':
397        flows = [f[0] for f in flows]  # assuming this is what you want to do when file_type is 'png'
398    font = figuresize/2
399    index = 0
400    for image, mask, flow in zip(batch, masks, flows):
401        unique_labels = np.unique(mask)
402        
403        num_objects = len(unique_labels[unique_labels != 0])
404        random_colors = np.random.rand(num_objects+1, 4)
405        random_colors[:, 3] = 1
406        random_colors[0, :] = [0, 0, 0, 1]
407        random_cmap = mpl.colors.ListedColormap(random_colors)
408        
409        if index < nr:
410            index += 1
411            chans = image.shape[-1]
412            fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, image.shape[-1] + 2, figsize=(4 * figuresize, figuresize))
413            for v in range(0, image.shape[-1]):
414                ax[v].imshow(image[..., v], cmap=cmap) #_imshow
415                ax[v].set_title('Image - Channel'+str(v))
416            ax[chans].imshow(mask, cmap=random_cmap) #_imshow
417            ax[chans].set_title('Mask')
418            if print_object_number:
419                unique_objects = np.unique(mask)[1:]
420                for obj in unique_objects:
421                    cy, cx = ndi.center_of_mass(mask == obj)
422                    ax[chans].text(cx, cy, str(obj), color='white', fontsize=font, ha='center', va='center')
423            ax[chans+1].imshow(flow, cmap='viridis') #_imshow
424            ax[chans+1].set_title('Flow')
425            plt.show()
426    return

Plot the masks and flows for a given batch of images.

Args: batch (numpy.ndarray): The batch of images. masks (list or numpy.ndarray): The masks corresponding to the images. flows (list or numpy.ndarray): The flows corresponding to the images. cmap (str, optional): The colormap to use for displaying the images. Defaults to 'inferno'. figuresize (int, optional): The size of the figure. Defaults to 20. nr (int, optional): The maximum number of images to plot. Defaults to 1. file_type (str, optional): The file type of the flows. Defaults to '.npz'. print_object_number (bool, optional): Whether to print the object number on the mask. Defaults to True.

Returns: None

def generate_mask_random_cmap(mask): 
467def generate_mask_random_cmap(mask):
468    """
469    Generate a random colormap based on the unique labels in the given mask.
470
471    Parameters:
472    mask (numpy.ndarray): The input mask array.
473
474    Returns:
475    matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap: The random colormap.
476    """
477    unique_labels = np.unique(mask)
478    num_objects = len(unique_labels[unique_labels != 0])
479    random_colors = np.random.rand(num_objects+1, 4)
480    random_colors[:, 3] = 1
481    random_colors[0, :] = [0, 0, 0, 1]
482    random_cmap = mpl.colors.ListedColormap(random_colors)
483    return random_cmap

Generate a random colormap based on the unique labels in the given mask.

Parameters: mask (numpy.ndarray): The input mask array.

Returns: matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap: The random colormap.

def random_cmap(num_objects=100): 
485def random_cmap(num_objects=100):
486    """
487    Generate a random colormap.
488
489    Parameters:
490    num_objects (int): The number of objects to generate colors for. Default is 100.
491
492    Returns:
493    random_cmap (matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap): A random colormap.
494    """
495    random_colors = np.random.rand(num_objects+1, 4)
496    random_colors[:, 3] = 1
497    random_colors[0, :] = [0, 0, 0, 1]
498    random_cmap = mpl.colors.ListedColormap(random_colors)
499    return random_cmap

Generate a random colormap.

Parameters: num_objects (int): The number of objects to generate colors for. Default is 100.

Returns: random_cmap (matplotlib.colors.ListedColormap): A random colormap.

def plot_images_and_arrays( folders, lower_percentile=1, upper_percentile=99, threshold=1000, extensions=['.npy', '.tif', '.tiff', '.png'], overlay=False, max_nr=None, randomize=True): 
543def plot_images_and_arrays(folders, lower_percentile=1, upper_percentile=99, threshold=1000, extensions=['.npy', '.tif', '.tiff', '.png'], overlay=False, max_nr=None, randomize=True):
544    
545    """
546    Plot images and arrays from the given folders.
547
548    Args:
549        folders (list): A list of folder paths containing the images and arrays.
550        lower_percentile (int, optional): The lower percentile for image normalization. Defaults to 1.
551        upper_percentile (int, optional): The upper percentile for image normalization. Defaults to 99.
552        threshold (int, optional): The threshold for determining whether to display an image as a mask or normalize it. Defaults to 1000.
553        extensions (list, optional): A list of file extensions to consider. Defaults to ['.npy', '.tif', '.tiff', '.png'].
554        overlay (bool, optional): If True, overlay the outlines of the objects on the image. Defaults to False.
555    """
556
557    def normalize_image(image, lower=1, upper=99):
558        p2, p98 = np.percentile(image, (lower, upper))
559        return np.clip((image - p2) / (p98 - p2), 0, 1)
560
561    def find_files(folders, extensions=['.npy', '.tif', '.tiff', '.png']):
562        file_dict = {}
563
564        for folder in folders:
565            for root, _, files in os.walk(folder):
566                for file in files:
567                    if any(file.endswith(ext) for ext in extensions):
568                        file_name_wo_ext = os.path.splitext(file)[0]
569                        file_path = os.path.join(root, file)
570                        if file_name_wo_ext not in file_dict:
571                            file_dict[file_name_wo_ext] = {}
572                        file_dict[file_name_wo_ext][folder] = file_path
573
574        # Filter out files that don't have paths in all folders
575        filtered_dict = {k: v for k, v in file_dict.items() if len(v) == len(folders)}
576        return filtered_dict
577
578    def plot_from_file_dict(file_dict, threshold=1000, lower_percentile=1, upper_percentile=99, overlay=False, save=False):
579        """
580        Plot images and arrays from the given file dictionary.
581
582        Args:
583            file_dict (dict): A dictionary containing the file paths for each image or array.
584            threshold (int, optional): The threshold for determining whether to display an image as a mask or normalize it. Defaults to 1000.
585            lower_percentile (int, optional): The lower percentile for image normalization. Defaults to 1.
586            upper_percentile (int, optional): The upper percentile for image normalization. Defaults to 99.
587            overlay (bool, optional): If True, overlay the outlines of the objects on the image. Defaults to False.
588        """
589
590        for filename, folder_paths in file_dict.items():
591            image_data = None
592            mask_data = None
593
594            for folder, path in folder_paths.items():
595                if path.endswith('.npy'):
596                    data = np.load(path)
597                elif path.endswith('.tif') or path.endswith('.tiff'):
598                    data = imageio.imread(path)
599                else:
600                    continue
601
602                unique_values = np.unique(data)
603
604                if len(unique_values) > threshold:
605                    image_data = normalize_image(data, lower_percentile, upper_percentile)
606                else:
607                    mask_data = data
608
609            if image_data is not None and mask_data is not None:
610                fig, axes = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(15, 7))
611                
612                # Display the mask with random colormap
613                cmap = random_cmap(num_objects=len(np.unique(mask_data)))
614                axes[0].imshow(mask_data, cmap=cmap)
615                axes[0].set_title(f"{filename} - Mask")
616                axes[0].axis('off')
617
618                # Display the normalized image
619                axes[1].imshow(image_data, cmap='gray')
620                if overlay:
621                    labeled_mask = label(mask_data)
622                    for region in regionprops(labeled_mask):
623                        if region.image.shape[0] >= 2 and region.image.shape[1] >= 2:
624                            contours = find_contours(region.image, 0.75)
625                            for contour in contours:
626                                # Adjust contour coordinates relative to the full image
627                                contour[:, 0] += region.bbox[0]
628                                contour[:, 1] += region.bbox[1]
629                                axes[1].plot(contour[:, 1], contour[:, 0], linewidth=2, color='magenta')
630
631                axes[1].set_title(f"{filename} - Normalized Image")
632                axes[1].axis('off')
633
634                plt.tight_layout()
635                plt.show()
636
637                if save:
638                    save_path = os.path.join(folder,f"{filename}.png")
639                    plt.savefig(save_path)
640
641    if overlay:
642        print(f'Overlay will only work on the first two folders in the list')
643
644    file_dict = find_files(folders, extensions)
645    items = list(file_dict.items())
646    if randomize:
647        random.shuffle(items)
648    if isinstance(max_nr, (int, float)):
649        items = items[:int(max_nr)]
650    file_dict = dict(items)
651
652    plot_from_file_dict(file_dict, threshold, lower_percentile, upper_percentile, overlay, save=False)
653    return

Plot images and arrays from the given folders.

Args: folders (list): A list of folder paths containing the images and arrays. lower_percentile (int, optional): The lower percentile for image normalization. Defaults to 1. upper_percentile (int, optional): The upper percentile for image normalization. Defaults to 99. threshold (int, optional): The threshold for determining whether to display an image as a mask or normalize it. Defaults to 1000. extensions (list, optional): A list of file extensions to consider. Defaults to ['.npy', '.tif', '.tiff', '.png']. overlay (bool, optional): If True, overlay the outlines of the objects on the image. Defaults to False.

def plot_arrays( src, figuresize=10, cmap='inferno', nr=1, normalize=True, q1=1, q2=99): 
725def plot_arrays(src, figuresize=10, cmap='inferno', nr=1, normalize=True, q1=1, q2=99):
726    """
727    Plot randomly selected arrays from a given directory.
728
729    Parameters:
730    - src (str): The directory path containing the arrays.
731    - figuresize (int): The size of the figure (default: 50).
732    - cmap (str): The colormap to use for displaying the arrays (default: 'inferno').
733    - nr (int): The number of arrays to plot (default: 1).
734    - normalize (bool): Whether to normalize the arrays (default: True).
735    - q1 (int): The lower percentile for normalization (default: 1).
736    - q2 (int): The upper percentile for normalization (default: 99).
737
738    Returns:
739    None
740    """
741    from .utils import normalize_to_dtype
742    
743    mask_cmap = random_cmap()
744    paths = []
745    for file in os.listdir(src):
746        if file.endswith('.npy'):
747            path = os.path.join(src, file)
748            paths.append(path)
749    paths = random.sample(paths, nr)
750    for path in paths:
751        print(f'Image path:{path}')
752        img = np.load(path)
753        if normalize:
754            img = normalize_to_dtype(array=img, p1=q1, p2=q2)
755        dim = img.shape
756        if len(img.shape)>2:
757            array_nr = img.shape[2]
758            fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, array_nr,figsize=(figuresize,figuresize))
759            for channel in range(array_nr):
760                i = np.take(img, [channel], axis=2)
761                axs[channel].imshow(i, cmap=plt.get_cmap(cmap)) #_imshow
762                axs[channel].set_title('Channel '+str(channel),size=24)
763                axs[channel].axis('off')
764        else:
765            fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1,figsize=(figuresize,figuresize))
766            ax.imshow(img, cmap=plt.get_cmap(cmap)) #_imshow
767            ax.set_title('Channel 0',size=24)
768            ax.axis('off')
769        fig.tight_layout()
770        plt.show()
771    return

Plot randomly selected arrays from a given directory.

Parameters:

  • src (str): The directory path containing the arrays.
  • figuresize (int): The size of the figure (default: 50).
  • cmap (str): The colormap to use for displaying the arrays (default: 'inferno').
  • nr (int): The number of arrays to plot (default: 1).
  • normalize (bool): Whether to normalize the arrays (default: True).
  • q1 (int): The lower percentile for normalization (default: 1).
  • q2 (int): The upper percentile for normalization (default: 99).

Returns: None

def plot_merged(src, settings): 
882def plot_merged(src, settings):
883    """
884    Plot the merged images after applying various filters and modifications.
885
886    Args:
887        src (path): Path to folder with images.
888        settings (dict): The settings for the plot.
889
890    Returns:
891        None
892    """
893    from .utils import _remove_noninfected
894
895    
896    
897    font = settings['figuresize']/2
898    outline_colors = _get_colours_merged(settings['outline_color'])
899    index = 0
900        
901    mask_dims = [settings['cell_mask_dim'], settings['nucleus_mask_dim'], settings['pathogen_mask_dim']]
902    mask_dims = [element for element in mask_dims if element is not None]
903    
904    if settings['verbose']:
905        display(settings)
906        
907    if settings['pathogen_mask_dim'] is None:
908        settings['pathogen_limit'] = True
909
910    for file in os.listdir(src):
911        path = os.path.join(src, file)
912        stack = np.load(path)
913        print(f'Loaded: {path}')
914        if settings['pathogen_limit'] > 0:
915            if settings['pathogen_mask_dim'] is not None and settings['cell_mask_dim'] is not None:
916                stack = _remove_noninfected(stack, settings['cell_mask_dim'], settings['nucleus_mask_dim'], settings['pathogen_mask_dim'])
917
918        if settings['pathogen_limit'] is not True or settings['nuclei_limit'] is not True or settings['filter_min_max'] is not None:
919            stack = _filter_objects_in_plot(stack, settings['cell_mask_dim'], settings['nucleus_mask_dim'], settings['pathogen_mask_dim'], mask_dims, settings['filter_min_max'], settings['nuclei_limit'], settings['pathogen_limit'])
920
921        overlayed_image, image, outlines = _normalize_and_outline(image=stack, 
922                                                                  remove_background=settings['remove_background'],
923                                                                  normalize=settings['normalize'],
924                                                                  normalization_percentiles=settings['normalization_percentiles'],
925                                                                  overlay=settings['overlay'],
926                                                                  overlay_chans=settings['overlay_chans'],
927                                                                  mask_dims=mask_dims,
928                                                                  outline_colors=outline_colors,
929                                                                  outline_thickness=settings['outline_thickness'])
930        if index < settings['nr']:
931            index += 1
932            fig = _plot_merged_plot(overlay=settings['overlay'],
933                                    image=image,
934                                    stack=stack,
935                                    mask_dims=mask_dims,
936                                    figuresize=settings['figuresize'],
937                                    overlayed_image=overlayed_image,
938                                    outlines=outlines,
939                                    cmap=settings['cmap'],
940                                    outline_colors=outline_colors,
941                                    print_object_number=settings['print_object_number'])
942        else:
943            return fig

Plot the merged images after applying various filters and modifications.

Args: src (path): Path to folder with images. settings (dict): The settings for the plot.

Returns: None

def generate_plate_heatmap(df, plate_number, variable, grouping, min_max, min_count): 
1653def generate_plate_heatmap(df, plate_number, variable, grouping, min_max, min_count):
1654
1655    if not isinstance(min_count, (int, float)):
1656        min_count = 0
1657
1658    # Check the number of parts in 'prc'
1659    num_parts = len(df['prc'].iloc[0].split('_'))
1660    if num_parts == 4:
1661        split = df['prc'].str.split('_', expand=True)
1662        df['rowID'] = split[2]
1663        df['prc'] = f"{plate_number}" + '_' + split[2] + '_' + split[3]
1664        
1665    # Construct 'prc' based on 'plateID', 'rowID', and 'columnID' columns
1666    #df['prc'] = df['plateID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['rowID'].astype(str) + '_' + df['columnID'].astype(str)
1667
1668    if 'column_name' not in df.columns:
1669        if 'column' in df.columns:
1670            df['columnID'] = df['column']
1671        if 'column_name' in df.columns:
1672            df['columnID'] = df['column_name']
1673                
1674    df['plateID'], df['rowID'], df['columnID'] = zip(*df['prc'].str.split('_'))
1675    
1676    # Filtering the dataframe based on the plate_number
1677    df = df[df['plateID'] == plate_number].copy()  # Create another copy after filtering
1678    
1679    # Ensure proper ordering
1680    row_order = [f'r{i}' for i in range(1, 17)]
1681    col_order = [f'c{i}' for i in range(1, 28)]  # Exclude c15 as per your earlier code
1682    
1683    df['rowID'] = pd.Categorical(df['rowID'], categories=row_order, ordered=True)
1684    df['columnID'] = pd.Categorical(df['columnID'], categories=col_order, ordered=True)
1685    df['count'] = df.groupby(['rowID', 'columnID'])['rowID'].transform('count')
1686
1687    if min_count > 0:
1688        df = df[df['count'] >= min_count]
1689
1690    # Explicitly set observed=True to avoid FutureWarning
1691    grouped = df.groupby(['rowID', 'columnID'], observed=True) # Group by row and column
1692    
1693    if grouping == 'mean':
1694        plate = grouped[variable].mean().reset_index()
1695    elif grouping == 'sum':
1696        plate = grouped[variable].sum().reset_index()
1697    elif grouping == 'count':
1698        variable = 'count'
1699        plate = grouped[variable].count().reset_index()
1700    else:
1701        raise ValueError(f"Unsupported grouping: {grouping}")
1702        
1703    plate_map = pd.pivot_table(plate, values=variable, index='rowID', columns='columnID').fillna(0)
1704    
1705    if min_max == 'all':
1706        min_max = [plate_map.min().min(), plate_map.max().max()]
1707    elif min_max == 'allq':
1708        min_max = np.quantile(plate_map.values, [0.02, 0.98])
1709    elif isinstance(min_max, (list, tuple)) and len(min_max) == 2:
1710        if isinstance(min_max[0], (float)) and isinstance(min_max[1], (float)):
1711            min_max = np.quantile(plate_map.values, [min_max[0], min_max[1]])
1712        if isinstance(min_max[0], (int)) and isinstance(min_max[1], (int)): 
1713            min_max = [min_max[0], min_max[1]]
1714    return plate_map, min_max
def plot_plates( df, variable, grouping, min_max, cmap, min_count=0, verbose=True, dst=None): 
1716def plot_plates(df, variable, grouping, min_max, cmap, min_count=0, verbose=True, dst=None):
1717    plates = df['prc'].str.split('_', expand=True)[0].unique()
1718    n_rows, n_cols = (len(plates) + 3) // 4, 4
1719    fig, ax = plt.subplots(n_rows, n_cols, figsize=(40, 5 * n_rows))
1720    ax = ax.flatten()
1721
1722    for index, plate in enumerate(plates):
1723        plate_map, min_max_values = generate_plate_heatmap(df, plate, variable, grouping, min_max, min_count)
1724        sns.heatmap(plate_map, cmap=cmap, vmin=min_max_values[0], vmax=min_max_values[1], ax=ax[index])
1725        ax[index].set_title(plate)
1726        
1727    for i in range(len(plates), n_rows * n_cols):
1728        fig.delaxes(ax[i])
1729    
1730    plt.subplots_adjust(wspace=0.1, hspace=0.4)
1731
1732    if not dst is None:
1733        for i in range(0,1000):
1734            filename = os.path.join(dst, f'plate_heatmap_{i}.pdf')
1735            if os.path.exists(filename):
1736                continue
1737            else:
1738                fig.savefig(filename, format='pdf')
1739                print(f'Saved heatmap to {filename}')
1740                break
1741    if verbose:
1742        plt.show()
1743    return fig
def print_mask_and_flows(stack, mask, flows, overlay=True, max_size=1000, thickness=2): 
1745def print_mask_and_flows(stack, mask, flows, overlay=True, max_size=1000, thickness=2):
1746    """
1747    Display the original image, mask with outlines, and flow images.
1748    
1749    Args:
1750        stack (np.array): Original image or stack.
1751        mask (np.array): Mask image.
1752        flows (list): List of flow images.
1753        overlay (bool): Whether to overlay the mask outlines on the original image.
1754        max_size (int): Maximum allowed size for any dimension of the images.
1755        thickness (int): Thickness of the contour outlines.
1756    """
1757
1758    def resize_if_needed(image, max_size):
1759        """Resize image if any dimension exceeds max_size while maintaining aspect ratio."""
1760        if max(image.shape[:2]) > max_size:
1761            scale = max_size / max(image.shape[:2])
1762            new_shape = (int(image.shape[0] * scale), int(image.shape[1] * scale))
1763            if image.ndim == 3:
1764                new_shape += (image.shape[2],)
1765            return sk_resize(image, new_shape, preserve_range=True, anti_aliasing=True).astype(image.dtype)
1766        return image
1767
1768    def generate_contours(mask):
1769        """Generate contours for each object in the mask using OpenCV."""
1770        contours, _ = cv2.findContours(mask.astype(np.uint8), cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
1771        return contours
1772
1773    def apply_contours_on_image(image, mask, color=(255, 0, 0), thickness=2):
1774        """Draw the contours on the original image."""
1775        # Ensure the image is in RGB format
1776        if image.ndim == 2:  # Grayscale to RGB
1777            image = normalize_to_uint8(image)  # Convert to uint8 if needed
1778            image_rgb = cv2.cvtColor(image, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2RGB)
1779        else:
1780            image_rgb = image.copy()
1781
1782        # Generate and draw contours
1783        contours = generate_contours(mask)
1784        cv2.drawContours(image_rgb, contours, -1, color, thickness)
1785
1786        return image_rgb
1787
1788    def normalize_to_uint8(image):
1789        """Normalize and convert image to uint8."""
1790        image = np.clip(image, 0, 1)  # Ensure values are between 0 and 1
1791        return (image * 255).astype(np.uint8)  # Convert to uint8
1792    
1793    
1794    # Resize if necessary
1795    stack = resize_if_needed(stack, max_size)
1796    mask = resize_if_needed(mask, max_size)
1797    if flows != None:
1798        flows = [resize_if_needed(flow, max_size) for flow in flows]
1799
1800        fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(12, 4))
1801    else:
1802        fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(12, 4))
1803
1804    if stack.shape[-1] == 1:
1805        stack = np.squeeze(stack)
1806
1807    # Display original image
1808    if stack.ndim == 2:
1809        original_image = stack
1810    elif stack.ndim == 3:
1811        original_image = stack[..., 0]  # Use the first channel as the base
1812    else:
1813        raise ValueError("Unexpected stack dimensionality.")
1814
1815    axs[0].imshow(original_image, cmap='gray')
1816    axs[0].set_title('Original Image')
1817    axs[0].axis('off')
1818
1819    # Overlay mask outlines on original image if overlay is True
1820    if overlay:
1821        outlined_image = apply_contours_on_image(original_image, mask, color=(255, 0, 0), thickness=thickness)
1822        axs[1].imshow(outlined_image)
1823    else:
1824        axs[1].imshow(mask, cmap='gray')
1825
1826    axs[1].set_title('Mask with Overlay' if overlay else 'Mask')
1827    axs[1].axis('off')
1828
1829    if flows != None:
1830
1831        # Display flow image or its first channel
1832        if flows and isinstance(flows, list) and flows[0].ndim in [2, 3]:
1833            flow_image = flows[0]
1834            if flow_image.ndim == 3:
1835                flow_image = flow_image[:, :, 0]  # Use first channel for 3D
1836            axs[2].imshow(flow_image, cmap='jet')
1837        else:
1838            raise ValueError("Unexpected flow dimensionality or structure.")
1839
1840        axs[2].set_title('Flows')
1841        axs[2].axis('off')
1842
1843    fig.tight_layout()
1844    plt.show()

Display the original image, mask with outlines, and flow images.

Args: stack (np.array): Original image or stack. mask (np.array): Mask image. flows (list): List of flow images. overlay (bool): Whether to overlay the mask outlines on the original image. max_size (int): Maximum allowed size for any dimension of the images. thickness (int): Thickness of the contour outlines.

def plot_resize_v1(images, resized_images, labels, resized_labels): 
1846def plot_resize_v1(images, resized_images, labels, resized_labels):
1847    # Display an example image and label before and after resizing
1848    fig, ax = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(20, 20))
1849    
1850    # Check if the image is grayscale; if so, add a colormap and keep dimensions correct
1851    if images[0].ndim == 2:  # Grayscale image
1852        ax[0, 0].imshow(images[0], cmap='gray')
1853    else:  # RGB or RGBA image
1854        ax[0, 0].imshow(images[0])
1855    ax[0, 0].set_title('Original Image')
1856
1857    if resized_images[0].ndim == 2:  # Grayscale image
1858        ax[0, 1].imshow(resized_images[0], cmap='gray')
1859    else:  # RGB or RGBA image
1860        ax[0, 1].imshow(resized_images[0])
1861    ax[0, 1].set_title('Resized Image')
1862
1863    # Assuming labels are always grayscale (most common scenario)
1864    ax[1, 0].imshow(labels[0], cmap='gray')
1865    ax[1, 0].set_title('Original Label')
1866    ax[1, 1].imshow(resized_labels[0], cmap='gray')
1867    ax[1, 1].set_title('Resized Label')
1868    plt.show()
def plot_resize(images, resized_images, labels, resized_labels): 
1871def plot_resize(images, resized_images, labels, resized_labels):
1872    def prepare_image(img):
1873        if img.ndim == 2:
1874            return img, 'gray'
1875        elif img.ndim == 3:
1876            if img.shape[-1] == 1:
1877                return np.squeeze(img, axis=-1), 'gray'
1878            elif img.shape[-1] == 3:
1879                return img, None  # RGB
1880            elif img.shape[-1] == 4:
1881                return img, None  # RGBA
1882            else:
1883                # fallback: average across channels to show as grayscale
1884                return np.mean(img, axis=-1), 'gray'
1885        else:
1886            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported image shape: {img.shape}")
1887
1888    fig, ax = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(20, 20))
1889
1890    # Original Image
1891    img, cmap = prepare_image(images[0])
1892    ax[0, 0].imshow(img, cmap=cmap)
1893    ax[0, 0].set_title('Original Image')
1894
1895    # Resized Image
1896    img, cmap = prepare_image(resized_images[0])
1897    ax[0, 1].imshow(img, cmap=cmap)
1898    ax[0, 1].set_title('Resized Image')
1899
1900    # Labels (assumed grayscale or single-channel)
1901    lbl, cmap = prepare_image(labels[0])
1902    ax[1, 0].imshow(lbl, cmap=cmap)
1903    ax[1, 0].set_title('Original Label')
1904
1905    lbl, cmap = prepare_image(resized_labels[0])
1906    ax[1, 1].imshow(lbl, cmap=cmap)
1907    ax[1, 1].set_title('Resized Label')
1908
1909    plt.tight_layout()
1910    plt.show()
def normalize_and_visualize(image, normalized_image, title=''): 
1912def normalize_and_visualize(image, normalized_image, title=""):
1913    """Utility function for visualization"""
1914    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(12, 6))
1915    if image.ndim == 3:  # Multi-channel image
1916        ax[0].imshow(np.mean(image, axis=-1), cmap='gray')  # Display the average over channels for visualization
1917    else:  # Grayscale image
1918        ax[0].imshow(image, cmap='gray')
1919    ax[0].set_title("Original " + title)
1920    ax[0].axis('off')
1921
1922    if normalized_image.ndim == 3:
1923        ax[1].imshow(np.mean(normalized_image, axis=-1), cmap='gray')  # Similarly, display the average over channels
1924    else:
1925        ax[1].imshow(normalized_image, cmap='gray')
1926    ax[1].set_title("Normalized " + title)
1927    ax[1].axis('off')
1928    
1929    plt.show()

Utility function for visualization

def visualize_masks(mask1, mask2, mask3, title='Masks Comparison'): 
1931def visualize_masks(mask1, mask2, mask3, title="Masks Comparison"):
1932    fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 3, figsize=(30, 10))
1933    for ax, mask, title in zip(axs, [mask1, mask2, mask3], ['Mask 1', 'Mask 2', 'Mask 3']):
1934        cmap = generate_mask_random_cmap(mask)
1935        # If the mask is binary, we can skip normalization
1936        if np.isin(mask, [0, 1]).all():
1937            ax.imshow(mask, cmap=cmap)
1938        else:
1939            # Normalize the image for displaying purposes
1940            norm = plt.Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=mask.max())
1941            ax.imshow(mask, cmap=cmap, norm=norm)
1942        ax.set_title(title)
1943        ax.axis('off')
1944    plt.suptitle(title)
1945    plt.show()
def visualize_cellpose_masks(masks, titles=None, filename=None, save=False, src=None): 
1947def visualize_cellpose_masks(masks, titles=None, filename=None, save=False, src=None):
1948    """
1949    Visualize multiple masks with optional titles.
1950    
1951    Parameters:
1952        masks (list of np.ndarray): A list of masks to visualize.
1953        titles (list of str, optional): A list of titles for the masks. If None, default titles will be used.
1954        comparison_title (str): Title for the entire figure.
1955    """
1956    
1957    comparison_title=f"Masks Comparison for {filename}"
1958    
1959    if titles is None:
1960        titles = [f'Mask {i+1}' for i in range(len(masks))]
1961    
1962    # Ensure the length of titles matches the number of masks
1963    assert len(titles) == len(masks), "Number of titles and masks must match"
1964    
1965    num_masks = len(masks)
1966    fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, num_masks, figsize=(10 * num_masks, 10))  # Adjusting figure size dynamically
1967    
1968    for ax, mask, title in zip(axs, masks, titles):
1969        cmap = generate_mask_random_cmap(mask)
1970        # Normalize and display the mask
1971        norm = plt.Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=mask.max())
1972        ax.imshow(mask, cmap=cmap, norm=norm)
1973        ax.set_title(title)
1974        ax.axis('off')
1975    
1976    plt.suptitle(comparison_title)
1977    plt.show()
1978    
1979    if save:
1980        if src is None:
1981            src = os.getcwd()
1982        results_dir = os.path.join(src, 'results')
1983        os.makedirs(results_dir, exist_ok=True)
1984        fig_path = os.path.join(results_dir, f'{filename}.pdf')
1985        fig.savefig(fig_path, format='pdf')
1986        print(f'Saved figure to {fig_path}')
1987    return

Visualize multiple masks with optional titles.

Parameters: masks (list of np.ndarray): A list of masks to visualize. titles (list of str, optional): A list of titles for the masks. If None, default titles will be used. comparison_title (str): Title for the entire figure.

def plot_comparison_results(comparison_results): 
1990def plot_comparison_results(comparison_results):
1991    df = pd.DataFrame(comparison_results)
1992    df_melted = pd.melt(df, id_vars=['filename'], var_name='metric', value_name='value')
1993    df_jaccard = df_melted[df_melted['metric'].str.contains('jaccard')]
1994    df_dice = df_melted[df_melted['metric'].str.contains('dice')]
1995    df_boundary_f1 = df_melted[df_melted['metric'].str.contains('boundary_f1')]
1996    df_ap = df_melted[df_melted['metric'].str.contains('average_precision')]
1997    fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 4, figsize=(40, 10))
1998    
1999    # Jaccard Index Plot
2000    sns.boxplot(data=df_jaccard, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[0], color='lightgrey')
2001    sns.stripplot(data=df_jaccard, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[0], jitter=True, alpha=0.6)
2002    axs[0].set_title('Jaccard Index by Comparison')
2003    axs[0].set_xticklabels(axs[0].get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, horizontalalignment='right')
2004    axs[0].set_xlabel('Comparison')
2005    axs[0].set_ylabel('Jaccard Index')
2006    # Dice Coefficient Plot
2007    sns.boxplot(data=df_dice, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[1], color='lightgrey')
2008    sns.stripplot(data=df_dice, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[1], jitter=True, alpha=0.6)
2009    axs[1].set_title('Dice Coefficient by Comparison')
2010    axs[1].set_xticklabels(axs[1].get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, horizontalalignment='right')
2011    axs[1].set_xlabel('Comparison')
2012    axs[1].set_ylabel('Dice Coefficient')
2013    # Border F1 scores
2014    sns.boxplot(data=df_boundary_f1, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[2], color='lightgrey')
2015    sns.stripplot(data=df_boundary_f1, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[2], jitter=True, alpha=0.6)
2016    axs[2].set_title('Boundary F1 Score by Comparison')
2017    axs[2].set_xticklabels(axs[2].get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, horizontalalignment='right')
2018    axs[2].set_xlabel('Comparison')
2019    axs[2].set_ylabel('Boundary F1 Score')
2020    # AP scores plot
2021    sns.boxplot(data=df_ap, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[3], color='lightgrey')
2022    sns.stripplot(data=df_ap, x='metric', y='value', ax=axs[3], jitter=True, alpha=0.6)
2023    axs[3].set_title('Average Precision by Comparison')
2024    axs[3].set_xticklabels(axs[3].get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, horizontalalignment='right')
2025    axs[3].set_xlabel('Comparison')
2026    axs[3].set_ylabel('Average Precision')
2027    
2028    plt.tight_layout()
2029    plt.show()
2030    return fig
def plot_object_outlines( src, objects=['nucleus', 'cell', 'pathogen'], channels=[0, 1, 2], max_nr=10): 
2032def plot_object_outlines(src, objects=['nucleus','cell','pathogen'], channels=[0,1,2], max_nr=10):

2036                   os.path.join(src,f'{channel+1}')]
2037        print(folders)
