2039                               lower_percentile=2,
2040                               upper_percentile=99.5,
2041                               threshold=1000,
2042                               extensions=['.npy', '.tif', '.tiff', '.png'],
2043                               overlay=True,
2044                               max_nr=10,
2045                               randomize=True)
def volcano_plot(coef_df, filename='volcano_plot.pdf'): 
2047def volcano_plot(coef_df, filename='volcano_plot.pdf'):
2048    palette = {
2049        'pc': 'red',
2050        'nc': 'green',
2051        'control': 'blue',
2052        'other': 'gray'
2053    }
2054
2055    # Create the volcano plot
2056    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
2057    sns.scatterplot(
2058        data=coef_df, 
2059        x='coefficient', 
2060        y='-log10(p_value)', 
2061        hue='condition', 
2062        palette=palette
2063    )
2064
2065    plt.title('Volcano Plot of Coefficients')
2066    plt.xlabel('Coefficient')
2067    plt.ylabel('-log10(p-value)')
2068    plt.axhline(y=-np.log10(0.05), color='red', linestyle='--')
2069    plt.legend().remove()
2070    plt.savefig(filename, format='pdf')
2071    print(f'Saved Volcano plot: {filename}')
2072    plt.show()
def plot_histogram(df, column, dst=None): 
2074def plot_histogram(df, column, dst=None):
2075    # Plot histogram of the dependent variable
2076    bar_color = (0/255, 155/255, 155/255)
2077    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10))
2078    sns.histplot(df[column], kde=False, color=bar_color, edgecolor=None, alpha=0.6)
2079    plt.title(f'Histogram of {column}')
2080    plt.xlabel(column)
2081    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
2082    
2083    if not dst is None:
2084        filename = os.path.join(dst, f'{column}_histogram.pdf')
2085        plt.savefig(filename, format='pdf')
2086        print(f'Saved histogram to {filename}')
2087
2088    plt.show()
def plot_lorenz_curves( csv_files, name_column='grna_name', value_column='count', remove_keys=None, x_lim=[0.0, 1], y_lim=[0, 1], remove_outliers=False, save=True): 
2090def plot_lorenz_curves(csv_files, name_column='grna_name', value_column='count', 
2091                       remove_keys=None, 
2092                       x_lim=[0.0, 1], y_lim=[0, 1], remove_outliers=False, save=True):
2093    
2094    def lorenz_curve(data):
2095        """Calculate Lorenz curve."""
2096        sorted_data = np.sort(data)
2097        cumulative_data = np.cumsum(sorted_data)
2098        lorenz_curve = cumulative_data / cumulative_data[-1]
2099        lorenz_curve = np.insert(lorenz_curve, 0, 0)
2100        return lorenz_curve
2101    
2102    def gini_coefficient(data):
2103        """Calculate Gini coefficient from data."""
2104        sorted_data = np.sort(data)
2105        n = len(data)
2106        cumulative_data = np.cumsum(sorted_data) / np.sum(sorted_data)
2107        cumulative_data = np.insert(cumulative_data, 0, 0)
2108        gini = 1 - 2 * np.sum(cumulative_data[:-1] * np.diff(np.linspace(0, 1, n + 1)))
2109        return gini
2110
2111    def remove_outliers_by_wells(data, name_col, wells_col):
2112        """Remove outliers based on 95% confidence interval for well counts."""
2113        well_counts = data.groupby(name_col).size()
2114        q1 = well_counts.quantile(0.05)
2115        q3 = well_counts.quantile(0.95)
2116        iqr_range = q3 - q1
2117        lower_bound = q1 - 1.5 * iqr_range
2118        upper_bound = q3 + 1.5 * iqr_range
2119        valid_names = well_counts[(well_counts >= lower_bound) & (well_counts <= upper_bound)].index
2120        return data[data[name_col].isin(valid_names)]
2121    
2122    combined_data = []
2123    gini_values = {}
2124
2125    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10))
2126
2127    for idx, csv_file in enumerate(csv_files):
2128        df = pd.read_csv(csv_file)
2129        
2130        # Remove specified keys
2131        for remove in remove_keys:
2132            df = df[df[name_column] != remove]
2133        
2134        # Remove outliers
2135        if remove_outliers:
2136            df = remove_outliers_by_wells(df, name_column, value_column)
2137        
2138        values = df[value_column].values
2139        combined_data.extend(values)
2140        
2141        # Calculate Lorenz curve and Gini coefficient
2142        lorenz = lorenz_curve(values)
2143        gini = gini_coefficient(values)
2144        gini_values[f"plate {idx+1}"] = gini
2145        
2146        name = f"plate {idx+1} (Gini: {gini:.4f})"
2147        plt.plot(np.linspace(0, 1, len(lorenz)), lorenz, label=name)
2148
2149    # Plot combined Lorenz curve
2150    combined_lorenz = lorenz_curve(np.array(combined_data))
2151    combined_gini = gini_coefficient(np.array(combined_data))
2152    gini_values["Combined"] = combined_gini
2153    
2154    plt.plot(np.linspace(0, 1, len(combined_lorenz)), combined_lorenz, label=f"Combined (Gini: {combined_gini:.4f})", linestyle='--', color='black')
2155    
2156    if x_lim is not None:
2157        plt.xlim(x_lim)
2158    
2159    if y_lim is not None:
2160        plt.ylim(y_lim)
2161        
2162    plt.title('Lorenz Curves')
2163    plt.xlabel('Cumulative Share of Individuals')
2164    plt.ylabel('Cumulative Share of Value')
2165    plt.legend()
2166    plt.grid(False)
2167    
2168    if save:
2169        save_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(csv_files[0]), 'results')
2170        os.makedirs(save_path, exist_ok=True)
2171        save_file_path = os.path.join(save_path, 'lorenz_curve_with_gini.pdf')
2172        plt.savefig(save_file_path, format='pdf', bbox_inches='tight')
2173        print(f"Saved Lorenz Curve: {save_file_path}")
2174    
2175    plt.show()
2176
2177    # Print Gini coefficients
2178    for plate, gini in gini_values.items():
2179        print(f"{plate}: Gini Coefficient = {gini:.4f}")
def plot_permutation(permutation_df): 
2181def plot_permutation(permutation_df):
2182    num_features = len(permutation_df)
2183    fig_height = max(8, num_features * 0.3)  # Set a minimum height of 8 and adjust height based on number of features
2184    fig_width = 10  # Width can be fixed or adjusted similarly
2185    font_size = max(10, 12 - num_features * 0.2)  # Adjust font size dynamically
2186
2187    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(fig_width, fig_height))
2188    ax.barh(permutation_df['feature'], permutation_df['importance_mean'], xerr=permutation_df['importance_std'], color="teal", align="center", alpha=0.6)
2189    ax.set_xlabel('Permutation Importance', fontsize=font_size)
2190    ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='major', labelsize=font_size)
2191    plt.tight_layout()
2192    return fig
def plot_feature_importance(feature_importance_df): 
2194def plot_feature_importance(feature_importance_df):
2195    num_features = len(feature_importance_df)
2196    fig_height = max(8, num_features * 0.3)  # Set a minimum height of 8 and adjust height based on number of features
2197    fig_width = 10  # Width can be fixed or adjusted similarly
2198    font_size = max(10, 12 - num_features * 0.2)  # Adjust font size dynamically
2199
2200    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(fig_width, fig_height))
2201    ax.barh(feature_importance_df['feature'], feature_importance_df['importance'], color="blue", align="center", alpha=0.6)
2202    ax.set_xlabel('Feature Importance', fontsize=font_size)
2203    ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='major', labelsize=font_size)
2204    plt.tight_layout()
2205    return fig
def read_and_plot__vision_results(base_dir, y_axis='accuracy', name_split='_time', y_lim=[0.8, 0.9]): 
2207def read_and_plot__vision_results(base_dir, y_axis='accuracy', name_split='_time', y_lim=[0.8, 0.9]):
2208    # List to store data from all CSV files
2209    data_frames = []
2210
2211    dst = os.path.join(base_dir, 'result')
2212    os.mkdir(dst,exists=True)
2213
2214    # Walk through the directory
2215    for root, dirs, files in os.walk(base_dir):
2216        for file in files:
2217            if file.endswith("_test_result.csv"):
2218                file_path = os.path.join(root, file)
2219                # Extract model information from the file name
2220                file_name = os.path.basename(file_path)
2221                model = file_name.split(f'{name_split}')[0]
2222                
2223                # Extract epoch information from the file name
2224                epoch_info = file_name.split('_time')[1]
2225                base_folder = os.path.dirname(file_path)
2226                epoch = os.path.basename(base_folder)
2227                
2228                # Read the CSV file
2229                df = pd.read_csv(file_path)
2230                df['model'] = model
2231                df['epoch'] = epoch
2232                
2233                # Append the data frame to the list
2234                data_frames.append(df)
2235    
2236    # Concatenate all data frames
2237    if data_frames:
2238        result_df = pd.concat(data_frames, ignore_index=True)
2239        
2240        # Calculate average y_axis per model
2241        avg_metric = result_df.groupby('model')[y_axis].mean().reset_index()
2242        avg_metric = avg_metric.sort_values(by=y_axis)
2243        print(avg_metric)
2244        
2245        # Plotting the results
2246        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
2247        plt.bar(avg_metric['model'], avg_metric[y_axis])
2248        plt.xlabel('Model')
2249        plt.ylabel(f'{y_axis}')
2250        plt.title(f'Average {y_axis.capitalize()} per Model')
2251        plt.xticks(rotation=45)
2252        plt.tight_layout()
2253        if y_lim is not None:
2254            plt.ylim(y_lim)
2255        plt.show()
2256    else:
2257        print("No CSV files found in the specified directory.")
def jitterplot_by_annotation( src, x_column, y_column, plot_title='Jitter Plot', output_path=None, filter_column=None, filter_values=None): 
2259def jitterplot_by_annotation(src, x_column, y_column, plot_title='Jitter Plot', output_path=None, filter_column=None, filter_values=None):
2260    """
2261    Reads a CSV file and creates a jitter plot of one column grouped by another column.
2262    
2263    Args:
2264    src (str): Path to the source data.
2265    x_column (str): Name of the column to be used for the x-axis.
2266    y_column (str): Name of the column to be used for the y-axis.
2267    plot_title (str): Title of the plot. Default is 'Jitter Plot'.
2268    output_path (str): Path to save the plot image. If None, the plot will be displayed. Default is None.
2269    
2270    Returns:
2271    pd.DataFrame: The filtered and balanced DataFrame.
2272    """
2273
2274    def join_measurments_and_annotation(src, tables = ['cell', 'nucleus', 'pathogen','cytoplasm']):
2275        from .io import _read_and_merge_data, _read_db
2276        db_loc = [src+'/measurements/measurements.db']
2277        loc = src+'/measurements/measurements.db'
2278        df, _ = _read_and_merge_data(db_loc, 
2279                                    tables, 
2280                                    verbose=True, 
2281                                    nuclei_limit=True, 
2282                                    pathogen_limit=True)
2283        
2284        paths_df = _read_db(loc, tables=['png_list'])
2285        merged_df = pd.merge(df, paths_df[0], on='prcfo', how='left')
2286        return merged_df
2287
2288    # Read the CSV file into a DataFrame
2289    df = join_measurments_and_annotation(src, tables=['cell', 'nucleus', 'pathogen', 'cytoplasm'])
2290
2291    # Print column names for debugging
2292    print(f"Generated dataframe with: {df.shape[1]} columns and {df.shape[0]} rows")
2293    #print("Columns in DataFrame:", df.columns.tolist())
2294
2295    # Replace NaN values with a specific label in x_column
2296    df[x_column] = df[x_column].fillna('NaN')
2297
2298    # Filter the DataFrame if filter_column and filter_values are provided
2299    if not filter_column is None:
2300        if isinstance(filter_column, str):
2301            df = df[df[filter_column].isin(filter_values)]
2302        if isinstance(filter_column, list):
2303            for i,val in enumerate(filter_column):
2304                print(f'hello {len(df)}')
2305                df = df[df[val].isin(filter_values[i])]
2306
2307    # Use the correct column names based on your DataFrame
2308    required_columns = ['plate_x', 'row_x', 'col_x']
2309    if not all(column in df.columns for column in required_columns):
2310        raise KeyError(f"DataFrame does not contain the necessary columns: {required_columns}")
2311
2312    # Filter to retain rows with non-NaN values in x_column and with matching plate, row, col values
2313    non_nan_df = df[df[x_column] != 'NaN']
2314    retained_rows = df[df[['plate_x', 'row_x', 'col_x']].apply(tuple, axis=1).isin(non_nan_df[['plate_x', 'row_x', 'col_x']].apply(tuple, axis=1))]
2315
2316    # Determine the minimum count of examples across all groups in x_column
2317    min_count = retained_rows[x_column].value_counts().min()
2318    print(f'Found {min_count} annotated images')
2319
2320    # Randomly sample min_count examples from each group in x_column
2321    balanced_df = retained_rows.groupby(x_column).apply(lambda x: x.sample(min_count, random_state=42)).reset_index(drop=True)
2322
2323    # Create the jitter plot
2324    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
2325    jitter_plot = sns.stripplot(data=balanced_df, x=x_column, y=y_column, hue=x_column, jitter=True, palette='viridis', dodge=False)
2326    plt.title(plot_title)
2327    plt.xlabel(x_column)
2328    plt.ylabel(y_column)
2329    
2330    # Customize the x-axis labels
2331    plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
2332    
2333    # Adjust the position of the x-axis labels to be centered below the data
2334    ax = plt.gca()
2335    ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='center')
2336    
2337    # Save the plot to a file or display it
2338    if output_path:
2339        plt.savefig(output_path, bbox_inches='tight')
2340        print(f"Jitter plot saved to {output_path}")
2341    else:
2342        plt.show()
2343
2344    return balanced_df

Reads a CSV file and creates a jitter plot of one column grouped by another column.

Args: src (str): Path to the source data. x_column (str): Name of the column to be used for the x-axis. y_column (str): Name of the column to be used for the y-axis. plot_title (str): Title of the plot. Default is 'Jitter Plot'. output_path (str): Path to save the plot image. If None, the plot will be displayed. Default is None.

Returns: pd.DataFrame: The filtered and balanced DataFrame.

def create_grouped_plot( df, grouping_column, data_column, graph_type='bar', summary_func='mean', order=None, colors=None, output_dir='./output', save=False, y_lim=None, error_bar_type='std'): 
2346def create_grouped_plot(df, grouping_column, data_column, graph_type='bar', summary_func='mean', order=None, colors=None, output_dir='./output', save=False, y_lim=None, error_bar_type='std'):
2347    """
2348    Create a grouped plot, perform statistical tests, and optionally export the results along with the plot.
2349
2350    Parameters:
2351    - df: DataFrame containing the data.
2352    - grouping_column: Column name for the categorical grouping.
2353    - data_column: Column name for the data to be grouped and plotted.
2354    - graph_type: Type of plot ('bar', 'violin', 'jitter', 'box', 'jitter_box').
2355    - summary_func: Summary function to apply to each group ('mean', 'median', etc.).
2356    - order: List specifying the order of the groups. If None, groups will be ordered alphabetically.
2357    - colors: List of colors for each group.
2358    - output_dir: Directory where the figure and test results will be saved if `save=True`.
2359    - save: Boolean flag indicating whether to save the plot and results to files.
2360    - y_lim: Optional y-axis min and max.
2361    - error_bar_type: Type of error bars to plot, either 'std' for standard deviation or 'sem' for standard error of the mean.
2362
2363    Outputs:
2364    - Figure of the plot.
2365    - DataFrame with full statistical test results, including normality tests.
2366    """
2367    
2368    # Remove NaN rows in grouping_column
2369    df = df.dropna(subset=[grouping_column])
2370    
2371    # Ensure the output directory exists if save is True
2372    if save:
2373        os.makedirs(output_dir, exist_ok=True)
2374    
2375    # Sorting and ordering
2376    if order:
2377        df[grouping_column] = pd.Categorical(df[grouping_column], categories=order, ordered=True)
2378    else:
2379        df[grouping_column] = pd.Categorical(df[grouping_column], categories=sorted(df[grouping_column].unique()), ordered=True)
2380    
2381    # Get unique groups
2382    unique_groups = df[grouping_column].unique()
2383    
2384    # Initialize test results
2385    test_results = []
2386
2387    # Test normality for each group
2388    grouped_data = [df.loc[df[grouping_column] == group, data_column] for group in unique_groups]
2389    normal_p_values = [normaltest(data).pvalue for data in grouped_data]
2390    normal_stats = [normaltest(data).statistic for data in grouped_data]
2391    is_normal = all(p > 0.05 for p in normal_p_values)
2392
2393    # Add normality test results to the results_df
2394    for group, stat, p_value in zip(unique_groups, normal_stats, normal_p_values):
2395        test_results.append({
2396            'Comparison': f'Normality test for {group}',
2397            'Test Statistic': stat,
2398            'p-value': p_value,
2399            'Test Name': 'Normality test'
2400        })
2401
2402    # Determine statistical test
2403    if len(unique_groups) == 2:
2404        if is_normal:
2405            stat_test = ttest_ind
2406            test_name = 'T-test'
2407        else:
2408            stat_test = mannwhitneyu
2409            test_name = 'Mann-Whitney U test'
2410    else:
2411        if is_normal:
2412            stat_test = f_oneway
2413            test_name = 'One-way ANOVA'
2414        else:
2415            stat_test = kruskal
2416            test_name = 'Kruskal-Wallis test'
2417
2418    # Perform pairwise statistical tests
2419    comparisons = list(itertools.combinations(unique_groups, 2))
2420    p_values = []
2421    test_statistics = []
2422
2423    for (group1, group2) in comparisons:
2424        data1 = df[df[grouping_column] == group1][data_column]
2425        data2 = df[df[grouping_column] == group2][data_column]
2426        stat, p = stat_test(data1, data2)
2427        p_values.append(p)
2428        test_statistics.append(stat)
2429        test_results.append({'Comparison': f'{group1} vs {group2}', 'Test Statistic': stat, 'p-value': p, 'Test Name': test_name})
2430    
2431    # Post-hoc test (Tukey HSD for ANOVA)
2432    posthoc_p_values = None
2433    if is_normal and len(unique_groups) > 2:
2434        tukey_result = pairwise_tukeyhsd(df[data_column], df[grouping_column], alpha=0.05)
2435        posthoc_p_values = tukey_result.pvalues
2436        for comparison, p_value in zip(tukey_result._results_table.data[1:], tukey_result.pvalues):
2437            test_results.append({
2438                'Comparison': f'{comparison[0]} vs {comparison[1]}',
2439                'Test Statistic': None,  # Tukey does not provide a test statistic in the same way
2440                'p-value': p_value,
2441                'Test Name': 'Tukey HSD Post-hoc'
2442            })
2443
2444    # Create plot
2445    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
2446    sns.set(style="whitegrid")
2447
2448    if colors:
2449        color_palette = colors
2450    else:
2451        color_palette = sns.color_palette("husl", len(unique_groups))
2452    
2453    # Choose graph type
2454    if graph_type == 'bar':
2455        summary_df = df.groupby(grouping_column)[data_column].agg([summary_func, 'std', 'sem'])
2456        
2457        # Set error bars based on error_bar_type
2458        if error_bar_type == 'std':
2459            error_bars = summary_df['std']
2460        elif error_bar_type == 'sem':
2461            error_bars = summary_df['sem']
2462        else:
2463            raise ValueError(f"Invalid error_bar_type: {error_bar_type}. Choose either 'std' or 'sem'.")
2464
2465        sns.barplot(x=grouping_column, y=summary_func, data=summary_df.reset_index(), ci=None, order=order, palette=color_palette)
2466
2467        # Add error bars (standard deviation or standard error of the mean)
2468        plt.errorbar(x=np.arange(len(summary_df)), y=summary_df[summary_func], yerr=error_bars, fmt='none', c='black', capsize=5)
2469    
2470    elif graph_type == 'violin':
2471        sns.violinplot(x=grouping_column, y=data_column, data=df, order=order, palette=color_palette)
2472    elif graph_type == 'jitter':
2473        sns.stripplot(x=grouping_column, y=data_column, data=df, jitter=True, order=order, palette=color_palette)
2474    elif graph_type == 'box':
2475        sns.boxplot(x=grouping_column, y=data_column, data=df, order=order, palette=color_palette)
2476    elif graph_type == 'jitter_box':
2477        sns.boxplot(x=grouping_column, y=data_column, data=df, order=order, palette=color_palette)
2478        sns.stripplot(x=grouping_column, y=data_column, data=df, jitter=True, color='black', alpha=0.5, order=order)
2479
2480    # Create a DataFrame to summarize the test results
2481    results_df = pd.DataFrame(test_results)
2482
2483    # Set y-axis start if provided
2484    if isinstance(y_lim, list) and len(y_lim) == 2:
2485        plt.ylim(y_lim)
2486
2487    # If save is True, save the plot and results as PNG and CSV
2488    if save:
2489        # Save the plot as PNG
2490        plot_path = os.path.join(output_dir, 'grouped_plot.png')
2491        plt.title(f'{test_name} results for {graph_type} plot')
2492        plt.xticks(rotation=45)
2493        plt.tight_layout()
2494        plt.savefig(plot_path)
2495        print(f"Plot saved to {plot_path}")
2496
2497        # Save the test results as a CSV file
2498        results_path = os.path.join(output_dir, 'test_results.csv')
2499        results_df.to_csv(results_path, index=False)
2500        print(f"Test results saved to {results_path}")
2501
2502    # Show the plot
2503    plt.show()
2504
2505    return plt.gcf(), results_df

Create a grouped plot, perform statistical tests, and optionally export the results along with the plot.

Parameters:

  • df: DataFrame containing the data.
  • grouping_column: Column name for the categorical grouping.
  • data_column: Column name for the data to be grouped and plotted.
  • graph_type: Type of plot ('bar', 'violin', 'jitter', 'box', 'jitter_box').
  • summary_func: Summary function to apply to each group ('mean', 'median', etc.).
  • order: List specifying the order of the groups. If None, groups will be ordered alphabetically.
  • colors: List of colors for each group.
  • output_dir: Directory where the figure and test results will be saved if save=True.
  • save: Boolean flag indicating whether to save the plot and results to files.
  • y_lim: Optional y-axis min and max.
  • error_bar_type: Type of error bars to plot, either 'std' for standard deviation or 'sem' for standard error of the mean.

Outputs:

  • Figure of the plot.
  • DataFrame with full statistical test results, including normality tests.
class spacrGraph: 
2507class spacrGraph:
2508    def __init__(self, df, grouping_column, data_column, graph_type='bar', summary_func='mean', 
2509                 order=None, colors=None, output_dir='./output', save=False, y_lim=None, log_y=False,
2510                 log_x=False, error_bar_type='std', remove_outliers=False, theme='pastel', representation='object',
2511                 paired=False, all_to_all=True, compare_group=None, graph_name=None):
2512        
2513        """
2514        Class for creating grouped plots with optional statistical tests and data preprocessing.
2515        """
2516
2517        self.df = df
2518        self.grouping_column = grouping_column
2519        self.order = sorted(df[self.grouping_column].unique().tolist())
2520        self.data_column = data_column if isinstance(data_column, list) else [data_column]
2521        
2522        self.graph_type = graph_type
2523        self.summary_func = summary_func
2524        self.order = order
2525        self.colors = colors
2526        self.output_dir = output_dir
2527        self.save = save
2528        self.error_bar_type = error_bar_type
2529        self.remove_outliers = remove_outliers
2530        self.theme = theme
2531        self.representation = representation
2532        self.paired = paired
2533        self.all_to_all = all_to_all
2534        self.compare_group = compare_group
2535        self.y_lim = y_lim
2536        self.graph_name = graph_name
2537        self.log_x = log_x
2538        self.log_y = log_y
2539
2540        self.results_df = pd.DataFrame()
2541        self.sns_palette = None
2542        self.fig = None
2543
2544        self.results_name = str(self.graph_name)+'_'+str(self.data_column[0])+'_'+str(self.grouping_column)+'_'+str(self.graph_type)
2545        
2546        self._set_theme()
2547        self.raw_df = self.df.copy()
2548        self.df = self.preprocess_data()
2549        
2550    def _set_theme(self):
2551        """Set the Seaborn theme and reorder colors if necessary."""
2552        integer_list = list(range(1, 81))
2553        color_order = [7,9,4,0,3,6,2] + integer_list
2554        self.sns_palette = self._set_reordered_theme(self.theme, color_order, 100)
2555
2556    def _set_reordered_theme(self, theme='deep', order=None, n_colors=100, show_theme=False):
2557        """Set and reorder the Seaborn color palette."""
2558        palette = sns.color_palette(theme, n_colors)
2559        if order:
2560            reordered_palette = [palette[i] for i in order]
2561        else:
2562            reordered_palette = palette
2563        if show_theme:
2564            sns.palplot(reordered_palette)
2565            plt.show()
2566        return reordered_palette
2567
2568    #def preprocess_data(self):
2569    #    """Preprocess the data: remove NaNs, sort/order the grouping column, and optionally group by 'prc'."""
2570    #    # Remove NaNs in both the grouping column and each data column
2571    #    df = self.df.dropna(subset=[self.grouping_column] + self.data_column)
2572    #    # Group by 'prc' column if representation is 'well'
2573    #    if self.representation == 'well':
2574    #        df = df.groupby(['prc', self.grouping_column])[self.data_column].agg(self.summary_func).reset_index()
2575    #    if self.representation == 'plateID':
2576    #        df = df.groupby(['plateID', self.grouping_column])[self.data_column].agg(self.summary_func).reset_index()
2577    #    if self.order:
2578    #        df[self.grouping_column] = pd.Categorical(df[self.grouping_column], categories=self.order, ordered=True)
2579    #    else:
2580    #        df[self.grouping_column] = pd.Categorical(df[self.grouping_column], categories=sorted(df[self.grouping_column].unique()), ordered=True)
2581    #    return df
2582  
2583    def preprocess_data(self):
2584        """
2585        Preprocess the data: remove NaNs, optionally ensure 'plateID' column is created,
2586        then group by either 'prc', 'plateID', or do no grouping at all if representation == 'object'.
2587        """
2588        # 1) Remove NaNs in both the grouping column and each data column
2589        df = self.df.dropna(subset=[self.grouping_column] + self.data_column)
2590
2591        # 2) Decide how to handle grouping based on 'representation'
2592        if self.representation == 'object':
2593            # -- No grouping at all --
2594            # We do nothing except keep df as-is after removing NaNs
2595            group_cols = None
2596
2597        elif self.representation == 'well':
2598            # Group by ['prc', grouping_column]
2599            group_cols = ['prc', self.grouping_column]
2600
2601        elif self.representation == 'plateID':
2602            # Make sure 'plateID' exists (split from 'prc' if needed)
2603            if 'plateID' not in df.columns:
2604                if 'prc' in df.columns:
2605                    df[['plateID', 'rowID', 'columnID']] = df['prc'].str.split('_', expand=True)
2606                else:
2607                    raise KeyError(
2608                        "Representation is 'plateID', but no 'plateID' column found. "
2609                        "Also cannot split from 'prc' because 'prc' column is missing."
2610                    )
2611            # If the grouping column IS 'plateID', only group by ['plateID'] once
2612            if self.grouping_column == 'plateID':
2613                group_cols = ['plateID']
2614            else:
2615                group_cols = ['plateID', self.grouping_column]
2616
2617        else:
2618            raise ValueError(f"Unknown representation: {self.representation}")
2619
2620        # 3) Perform grouping only if group_cols is set
2621        if group_cols is not None:
2622            df = df.groupby(group_cols)[self.data_column].agg(self.summary_func).reset_index()
2623
2624        # 4) Handle ordering if specified (and if the grouping_column still exists)
2625        if self.order and (self.grouping_column in df.columns):
2626            df[self.grouping_column] = pd.Categorical(
2627                df[self.grouping_column],
2628                categories=self.order,
2629                ordered=True
2630            )
2631        elif (self.grouping_column in df.columns):
2632            # Default to sorting unique values
2633            df[self.grouping_column] = pd.Categorical(
2634                df[self.grouping_column],
2635                categories=sorted(df[self.grouping_column].unique()),
2636                ordered=True
2637            )
2638
2639        return df
2640   
2641    def remove_outliers_from_plot(self):
2642        """Remove outliers from the plot but keep them in the data."""
2643        filtered_df = self.df.copy()
2644        unique_groups = filtered_df[self.grouping_column].unique()
2645        for group in unique_groups:
2646            group_data = filtered_df[filtered_df[self.grouping_column] == group][self.data_column]
2647            q1 = group_data.quantile(0.25)
2648            q3 = group_data.quantile(0.75)
2649            iqr = q3 - q1
2650            lower_bound = q1 - 1.5 * iqr
2651            upper_bound = q3 + 1.5 * iqr
2652            filtered_df = filtered_df.drop(filtered_df[(filtered_df[self.grouping_column] == group) & ((filtered_df[self.data_column] < lower_bound) | (filtered_df[self.data_column] > upper_bound))].index)
2653        return filtered_df
2654
2655    def perform_normality_tests(self):
2656        """Perform normality tests for each group and data column."""
2657        unique_groups = self.df[self.grouping_column].unique()
2658        normality_results = []
2659
2660        for column in self.data_column:
2661            for group in unique_groups:
2662                data = self.df.loc[self.df[self.grouping_column] == group, column].dropna()
2663                n_samples = len(data)
2664
2665                if n_samples < 3:
2666                    # Skip test if there aren't enough data points
2667                    print(f"Skipping normality test for group '{group}' on column '{column}' - Not enough data.")
2668                    normality_results.append({
2669                        'Comparison': f'Normality test for {group} on {column}',
2670                        'Test Statistic': None,
2671                        'p-value': None,
2672                        'Test Name': 'Skipped',
2673                        'Column': column,
2674                        'n': n_samples
2675                    })
2676                    continue
2677
2678                # Choose the appropriate normality test based on the sample size
2679                if n_samples >= 8:
2680                    stat, p_value = normaltest(data)
2681                    test_name = "D'Agostino-Pearson test"
2682                else:
2683                    stat, p_value = shapiro(data)
2684                    test_name = "Shapiro-Wilk test"
2685
2686                # Store the result for this group and column
2687                normality_results.append({
2688                    'Comparison': f'Normality test for {group} on {column}',
2689                    'Test Statistic': stat,
2690                    'p-value': p_value,
2691                    'Test Name': test_name,
2692                    'Column': column,
2693                    'n': n_samples
2694                })
2695
2696            # Check if all groups are normally distributed (p > 0.05)
2697            normal_p_values = [result['p-value'] for result in normality_results if result['Column'] == column and result['p-value'] is not None]
2698            is_normal = all(p > 0.05 for p in normal_p_values)
2699
2700        return is_normal, normality_results
2701
2702    def perform_levene_test(self, unique_groups):
2703        """Perform Levene's test for equal variance."""
2704        grouped_data = [self.df.loc[self.df[self.grouping_column] == group, self.data_column] for group in unique_groups]
2705        stat, p_value = levene(*grouped_data)
2706        return stat, p_value
2707
2708    def perform_statistical_tests(self, unique_groups, is_normal):
2709        """Perform statistical tests separately for each data column."""
2710        test_results = []
2711        for column in self.data_column:  # Iterate over each data column
2712            grouped_data = [self.df.loc[self.df[self.grouping_column] == group, column] for group in unique_groups]
2713            if len(unique_groups) == 2:  # For two groups: class_0 vs class_1
2714                if is_normal:
2715                    if self.paired:
2716                        stat, p = pg.ttest(grouped_data[0], grouped_data[1], paired=True).iloc[0][['T', 'p-val']]
2717                        test_name = 'Paired T-test'
2718                    else:
2719                        stat, p = ttest_ind(grouped_data[0], grouped_data[1])
2720                        test_name = 'T-test'
2721                else:
2722                    if self.paired:
2723                        stat, p = pg.wilcoxon(grouped_data[0], grouped_data[1]).iloc[0][['T', 'p-val']]
2724                        test_name = 'Paired Wilcoxon test'
2725                    else:
2726                        stat, p = mannwhitneyu(grouped_data[0], grouped_data[1])
2727                        test_name = 'Mann-Whitney U test'
2728            else:
2729                if is_normal:
2730                    stat, p = f_oneway(*grouped_data)
2731                    test_name = 'One-way ANOVA'
2732                else:
2733                    stat, p = kruskal(*grouped_data)
2734                    test_name = 'Kruskal-Wallis test'
2735
2736            test_results.append({
2737                'Comparison': f'{unique_groups[0]} vs {unique_groups[1]} ({column})',
2738                'Test Statistic': stat,
2739                'p-value': p,
2740                'Test Name': test_name,
2741                'Column': column,
2742                'n_object': len(grouped_data[0]) + len(grouped_data[1]),
2743                'n_well': len(self.df[self.df[self.grouping_column] == unique_groups[0]]) + 
2744                          len(self.df[self.df[self.grouping_column] == unique_groups[1]])})
2745
2746        return test_results
2747    
2748    def perform_posthoc_tests(self, is_normal, unique_groups):
2749        """Perform post-hoc tests for multiple groups based on all_to_all flag."""
2750
2751        from .sp_stats import choose_p_adjust_method
2752
2753        posthoc_results = []
2754        if is_normal and len(unique_groups) > 2 and self.all_to_all:
2755            tukey_result = pairwise_tukeyhsd(self.df[self.data_column], self.df[self.grouping_column], alpha=0.05)
2756            posthoc_results = []
2757            for comparison, p_value in zip(tukey_result._results_table.data[1:], tukey_result.pvalues):
2758                raw_data1 = self.raw_df[self.raw_df[self.grouping_column] == comparison[0]][self.data_column]
2759                raw_data2 = self.raw_df[self.raw_df[self.grouping_column] == comparison[1]][self.data_column]
2760
2761                posthoc_results.append({
2762                    'Comparison': f'{comparison[0]} vs {comparison[1]}',
2763                    'Test Statistic': None,  # Tukey does not provide a test statistic
2764                    'p-value': p_value,
2765                    'Test Name': 'Tukey HSD Post-hoc',
2766                    'n_object': len(raw_data1) + len(raw_data2),
2767                    'n_well': len(self.df[self.df[self.grouping_column] == comparison[0]]) + len(self.df[self.df[self.grouping_column] == comparison[1]])})
2768            return posthoc_results
2769        
2770        elif len(unique_groups) > 2 and self.all_to_all:
2771            print('performing_dunns')
2772
2773            # Prepare data for Dunn's test in long format
2774            long_data = self.df[[self.data_column[0], self.grouping_column]].dropna()
2775
2776            p_adjust_method = choose_p_adjust_method(num_groups=len(long_data[self.grouping_column].unique()),num_data_points=len(long_data) // len(long_data[self.grouping_column].unique()))
2777
2778            # Perform Dunn's test with Bonferroni correction
2779            dunn_result = sp.posthoc_dunn(
2780                long_data, 
2781                val_col=self.data_column[0], 
2782                group_col=self.grouping_column, 
2783                p_adjust=p_adjust_method
2784            )
2785
2786            for group_a, group_b in zip(*np.triu_indices_from(dunn_result, k=1)):
2787                raw_data1 = self.raw_df[self.raw_df[self.grouping_column] == dunn_result.index[group_a]][self.data_column]
2788                raw_data2 = self.raw_df[self.raw_df[self.grouping_column] == dunn_result.columns[group_b]][self.data_column]
2789
2790                posthoc_results.append({
2791                    'Comparison': f"{dunn_result.index[group_a]} vs {dunn_result.columns[group_b]}",
2792                    'Test Statistic': None,  # Dunn's test does not return a specific test statistic
2793                    'p-value': dunn_result.iloc[group_a, group_b],  # Extract the p-value from the matrix
2794                    'Test Name': "Dunn's Post-hoc",
2795                    'p_adjust_method': p_adjust_method,
2796                    'n_object': len(raw_data1) + len(raw_data2),  # Total objects
2797                    'n_well': len(self.df[self.df[self.grouping_column] == dunn_result.index[group_a]]) +
2798                            len(self.df[self.grouping_column] == dunn_result.columns[group_b])})
2799
2800            return posthoc_results
2801
2802        return posthoc_results
2803    
2804    def create_plot(self, ax=None):
2805        """Create and display the plot based on the chosen graph type."""
2806
2807        def _generate_tabels(unique_groups):
2808            """Generate row labels and a symbol table for multi-level grouping."""
2809            # Create row labels: Include the grouping column and data columns
2810            row_labels = [self.grouping_column] + self.data_column
2811
2812            # Initialize table data
2813            table_data = []
2814
2815            # Create the grouping row: Alternate each group for every data column
2816            grouping_row = []
2817            for _ in self.data_column:
2818                for group in unique_groups:
2819                    grouping_row.append(group)
2820            table_data.append(grouping_row)  # Add the grouping row to the table
2821
2822            # Create symbol rows for each data column
2823            for column in self.data_column:
2824                column_row = []  # Initialize a row for this column
2825                for data_col in self.data_column:  # Iterate over data columns to align with the structure
2826                    for group in unique_groups:
2827                        # Assign '+' if the column matches, otherwise assign '-'
2828                        if column == data_col:
2829                            column_row.append('+')
2830                        else:
2831                            column_row.append('-')
2832                table_data.append(column_row)  # Add this row to the table
2833
2834            # Transpose the table to align with the plot layout
2835            transposed_table = list(map(list, zip(*table_data)))
2836            return row_labels, transposed_table
2837
2838
2839        def _place_symbols(row_labels, transposed_table, x_positions, ax):
2840            """
2841            Places symbols and row labels aligned under the bars or jitter points on the graph.
2842            
2843            Parameters:
2844            - row_labels: List of row titles to be displayed along the y-axis.
2845            - transposed_table: Data to be placed under each bar/jitter as symbols.
2846            - x_positions: X-axis positions for each group to align the symbols.
2847            - ax: The matplotlib Axes object where the plot is drawn.
2848            """
2849            # Get plot dimensions and adjust for different plot sizes
2850            y_axis_min = ax.get_ylim()[0]  # Minimum y-axis value (usually 0)
2851            symbol_start_y = y_axis_min - 0.05 * (ax.get_ylim()[1] - y_axis_min)  # Adjust a bit below the x-axis
2852
2853            # Calculate spacing for the table rows (adjust as needed)
2854            y_spacing = 0.04  # Adjust this for better spacing between rows
2855
2856            # Determine the leftmost x-position for row labels (align with the y-axis)
2857            label_x_pos = ax.get_xlim()[0] - 0.3  # Adjust offset from the y-axis
2858
2859            # Place row labels vertically aligned with symbols
2860            for row_idx, title in enumerate(row_labels):
2861                y_pos = symbol_start_y - (row_idx * y_spacing)  # Calculate vertical position for each label
2862                ax.text(label_x_pos, y_pos, title, ha='right', va='center', fontsize=12, fontweight='regular')
2863
2864            # Place symbols under each bar or jitter point based on x-positions
2865            for idx, (x_pos, column_data) in enumerate(zip(x_positions, transposed_table)):
2866                for row_idx, text in enumerate(column_data):
2867                    y_pos = symbol_start_y - (row_idx * y_spacing)  # Adjust vertical spacing for symbols
2868                    ax.text(x_pos, y_pos, text, ha='center', va='center', fontsize=12, fontweight='regular')
2869
2870            # Redraw to apply changes
2871            ax.figure.canvas.draw()
2872                    
2873        def _get_positions(self, ax):
2874            if self.graph_type in ['bar','jitter_bar']: 
2875                x_positions = [np.mean(bar.get_paths()[0].vertices[:, 0]) for bar in ax.collections if hasattr(bar, 'get_paths')]
2876
2877            elif self.graph_type == 'violin':
2878                x_positions = [np.mean(violin.get_paths()[0].vertices[:, 0]) for violin in ax.collections if hasattr(violin, 'get_paths')]
2879
2880            elif self.graph_type in ['box', 'jitter_box']:
2881                x_positions = list(set(line.get_xdata().mean() for line in ax.lines if line.get_linestyle() == '-'))                
2882
2883            elif self.graph_type == 'jitter': 
2884                x_positions = [np.mean(collection.get_offsets()[:, 0]) for collection in ax.collections if collection.get_offsets().size > 0]
2885            
2886            elif self.graph_type in ['line', 'line_std']:
2887                x_positions = []
2888            
2889            return x_positions
2890        
2891        def _draw_comparison_lines(ax, x_positions):
2892            """Draw comparison lines and annotate significance based on results_df."""
2893            if self.results_df.empty:
2894                print("No comparisons available to annotate.")
2895                return
2896
2897            y_max = max([bar.get_height() for bar in ax.patches])
2898            ax.set_ylim(0, y_max * 1.3)
2899
2900            for idx, row in self.results_df.iterrows():
2901                group1, group2 = row['Comparison'].split(' vs ')
2902                p_value = row['p-value']
2903
2904                # Determine significance marker
2905                if p_value <= 0.001:
2906                    signiresults_namecance = '***'
2907                elif p_value <= 0.01:
2908                    significance = '**'
2909                elif p_value <= 0.05:
2910                    significance = '*'
2911                else:
2912                    significance = 'ns'
2913
2914                # Find the x positions of the compared groups
2915                x1 = x_positions[unique_groups.tolist().index(group1)]
2916                x2 = x_positions[unique_groups.tolist().index(group2)]
2917
2918                # Stagger lines to avoid overlap
2919                line_y = y_max + (0.1 * y_max) * (idx + 1)
2920
2921                # Draw the comparison line
2922                ax.plot([x1, x1, x2, x2], [line_y - 0.02, line_y, line_y, line_y - 0.02], lw=1.5, c='black')
2923
2924                # Add the significance marker
2925                ax.text((x1 + x2) / 2, line_y, significance, ha='center', va='bottom', fontsize=12)
2926
2927        # Optional: Remove outliers for plotting
2928        if self.remove_outliers:
2929            self.df = self.remove_outliers_from_plot()
2930
2931        self.df_melted = pd.melt(self.df, id_vars=[self.grouping_column], value_vars=self.data_column,var_name='Data Column', value_name='Value')
2932        unique_groups = self.df[self.grouping_column].unique()
2933        is_normal, normality_results = self.perform_normality_tests()
2934        levene_stat, levene_p = self.perform_levene_test(unique_groups)
2935        test_results = self.perform_statistical_tests(unique_groups, is_normal)
2936        posthoc_results = self.perform_posthoc_tests(is_normal, unique_groups)
2937        self.results_df = pd.DataFrame(normality_results + test_results + posthoc_results)
2938
2939        num_groups = len(self.data_column)*len(self.grouping_column)
2940        num_data_columns = len(self.data_column)
2941        self.bar_width = 0.4
2942        spacing_between_groups = self.bar_width/0.5
2943
2944        self.fig_width = (num_groups * self.bar_width) + (spacing_between_groups * num_groups)
2945        self.fig_height = self.fig_width/2
2946        
2947        if  self.graph_type in ['line','line_std']:
2948            self.fig_height, self.fig_width = 10, 10 
2949
2950        if ax is None:
2951            self.fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(self.fig_height, self.fig_width))
2952        else:
2953            self.fig = ax.figure
2954
2955        if len(self.data_column) == 1:
2956            self.hue=self.grouping_column
2957            self.jitter_bar_dodge = False
2958        else:
2959            self.hue='Data Column'
2960            self.jitter_bar_dodge = True
2961        
2962        # Handle the different plot types based on `graph_type`
2963        if self.graph_type == 'bar':
2964            self._create_bar_plot(ax)
2965        elif self.graph_type == 'jitter':
2966            self._create_jitter_plot(ax)
2967        elif self.graph_type == 'box':
2968            self._create_box_plot(ax)
2969        elif self.graph_type == 'violin':
2970            self._create_violin_plot(ax)
2971        elif self.graph_type == 'jitter_box':
2972            self._create_jitter_box_plot(ax)
2973        elif self.graph_type == 'jitter_bar':
2974            self._create_jitter_bar_plot(ax)
2975        elif self.graph_type == 'line':
2976            self._create_line_graph(ax)
2977        elif self.graph_type == 'line_std':
2978            self._create_line_with_std_area(ax)
2979        else:
2980            raise ValueError(f"Unknown graph type: {self.graph_type}") 
2981        
2982        if len(self.data_column) == 1:
2983            num_groups = len(self.df[self.grouping_column].unique())
2984            self._standerdize_figure_format(ax=ax, num_groups=num_groups, graph_type=self.graph_type)
2985
2986        # Set y-axis start
2987        if isinstance(self.y_lim, list):
2988            if len(self.y_lim) == 2:
2989                ax.set_ylim(self.y_lim[0], self.y_lim[1])
2990            elif len(self.y_lim) == 1:
2991                ax.set_ylim(self.y_lim[0], None)
2992
2993        sns.despine(ax=ax, top=True, right=True)
2994        ax.legend(loc='center left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 0.5), title='Data Column') # Move the legend outside the plot
2995        
2996        if not self.graph_type in ['line','line_std']:
2997            ax.set_xlabel('')
2998
2999        x_positions = _get_positions(self, ax)
3000        
3001        if len(self.data_column) == 1 and not self.graph_type in ['line','line_std']:
3002            ax.legend().remove()
3003            ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='right')
3004
3005        elif len(self.data_column) > 1 and not self.graph_type in ['line','line_std']:
3006            ax.set_xticks([])
3007            ax.tick_params(bottom=False)
3008            ax.set_xticklabels([])
3009            legend_ax = self.fig.add_axes([0.1, -0.2, 0.62, 0.2])  # Position the table closer to the graph
3010            legend_ax.set_axis_off()
3011
3012            row_labels, table_data = _generate_tabels(unique_groups)
3013            _place_symbols(row_labels, table_data, x_positions, ax)
3014            
3015        #_draw_comparison_lines(ax, x_positions)    
3016        
3017        if self.save:
3018            self._save_results()
3019
3020        ax.margins(x=0.12)
3021
3022    def _standerdize_figure_format(self, ax, num_groups, graph_type):
3023        """
3024        Adjusts the figure layout (size, bar width, jitter, and spacing) based on the number of groups.
3025
3026        Parameters:
3027        - ax: The matplotlib Axes object.
3028        - num_groups: Number of unique groups.
3029        - graph_type: The type of graph (e.g., 'bar', 'jitter', 'box', etc.).
3030
3031        Returns:
3032        - None. Modifies the figure and Axes in place.
3033        """
3034        if graph_type in ['line', 'line_std']:
3035            print("Skipping layout adjustment for line graphs.")
3036            return  # Skip layout adjustment for line graphs
3037        
3038        correction_factor = 4
3039
3040        # Set figure size to ensure it remains square with a minimum size
3041        fig_size = max(6, num_groups * 2)  / correction_factor
3042        
3043        if fig_size < 10:
3044            fig_size = 10
3045        
3046        
3047        ax.figure.set_size_inches(fig_size, fig_size)
3048
3049        # Configure layout based on the number of groups
3050        bar_width = min(0.8, 1.5 / num_groups) / correction_factor
3051        jitter_amount = min(0.1, 0.2 / num_groups) / correction_factor
3052        jitter_size = max(50 / num_groups, 200)
3053
3054        # Adjust axis limits to ensure bars are centered with respect to group labels
3055        ax.set_xlim(-0.5, num_groups - 0.5)
3056
3057        # Set ticks to match the group labels in your DataFrame
3058        #group_labels = self.df[self.grouping_column].unique()
3059        #group_labels = self.order
3060        #ax.set_xticks(range(len(group_labels)))
3061        #ax.set_xticklabels(group_labels, rotation=45, ha='right')
3062        plt.setp(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='right')
3063
3064        # Customize elements based on the graph type
3065        if graph_type == 'bar':
3066            # Adjust bars' width and position
3067            for bar in ax.patches:
3068                bar.set_width(bar_width)
3069                bar.set_x(bar.get_x() - bar_width / 2)
3070
3071        elif graph_type in ['jitter', 'jitter_bar', 'jitter_box']:
3072            # Adjust jitter points' position and size
3073            for coll in ax.collections:
3074                offsets = coll.get_offsets()
3075                offsets[:, 0] += jitter_amount  # Shift jitter points slightly
3076                coll.set_offsets(offsets)
3077                coll.set_sizes([jitter_size]  * len(offsets))  # Adjust point size dynamically
3078
3079        elif graph_type in ['box', 'violin']:
3080            # Adjust box width for consistent spacing
3081            for artist in ax.artists:
3082                artist.set_width(bar_width)
3083
3084        # Adjust legend and axis labels
3085        ax.tick_params(axis='x', labelsize=max(10, 15 - num_groups // 2))
3086        ax.tick_params(axis='y', labelsize=max(10, 15 - num_groups // 2))
3087
3088        if ax.get_legend():
3089            ax.get_legend().set_bbox_to_anchor((1.05, 1)) #loc='upper left',borderaxespad=0.
3090            ax.get_legend().prop.set_size(max(8, 12 - num_groups // 3))
3091
3092        # Redraw the figure to apply changes
3093        ax.figure.canvas.draw()
3094        
3095    def _create_bar_plot(self, ax):
3096        """Helper method to create a bar plot with consistent bar thickness and centered error bars."""
3097        # Flatten DataFrame: Combine grouping column and data column into one group if needed
3098        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3099            self.df_melted['Combined Group'] = (self.df_melted[self.grouping_column].astype(str) + " - " + self.df_melted['Data Column'].astype(str))
3100            x_axis_column = 'Combined Group'
3101            hue = None
3102            ax.set_ylabel('Value')
3103        else:
3104            x_axis_column = self.grouping_column
3105            ax.set_ylabel(self.data_column[0])
3106            hue = None
3107    
3108        summary_df = self.df_melted.groupby([x_axis_column]).agg(mean=('Value', 'mean'),std=('Value', 'std'),sem=('Value', 'sem')).reset_index()
3109        error_bars = summary_df[self.error_bar_type] if self.error_bar_type in ['std', 'sem'] else None
3110        sns.barplot(data=self.df_melted, x=x_axis_column, y='Value', hue=self.hue, palette=self.sns_palette, ax=ax, dodge=self.jitter_bar_dodge, ci=None, order=self.order)
3111        
3112        # Adjust the bar width manually
3113        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3114            bars = [bar for bar in ax.patches if isinstance(bar, plt.Rectangle)]
3115            target_width = self.bar_width * 2
3116            for bar in bars:
3117                bar.set_width(target_width)  # Set new width
3118                # Center the bar on its x-coordinate
3119                bar.set_x(bar.get_x() - target_width / 2)
3120            
3121        # Adjust error bars alignment with bars
3122        bars = [bar for bar in ax.patches if isinstance(bar, plt.Rectangle)]
3123        for bar, (_, row) in zip(bars, summary_df.iterrows()):
3124            x_bar = bar.get_x() + bar.get_width() / 2
3125            err = row[self.error_bar_type]
3126            ax.errorbar(x=x_bar, y=bar.get_height(), yerr=err, fmt='none', c='black', capsize=5, lw=2)
3127    
3128        # Set legend and labels
3129        ax.set_xlabel(self.grouping_column)
3130
3131        if self.log_y:
3132            ax.set_yscale('log')
3133        if self.log_x:
3134            ax.set_xscale('log')
3135
3136    def _create_jitter_plot(self, ax):
3137        """Helper method to create a jitter plot (strip plot) with consistent spacing."""
3138        # Combine grouping column and data column if needed
3139        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3140            self.df_melted['Combined Group'] = (self.df_melted[self.grouping_column].astype(str)  + " - " + self.df_melted['Data Column'].astype(str))
3141            x_axis_column = 'Combined Group'
3142            hue = None  # Disable hue to avoid two-level grouping
3143            ax.set_ylabel('Value')
3144        else:
3145            x_axis_column = self.grouping_column
3146            ax.set_ylabel(self.data_column[0])
3147            hue = None
3148    
3149        # Create the jitter plot
3150        sns.stripplot(data=self.df_melted,x=x_axis_column,y='Value',hue=self.hue, palette=self.sns_palette, dodge=self.jitter_bar_dodge, jitter=self.bar_width, ax=ax, alpha=0.6, size=16, order=self.order)
3151    
3152        # Adjust legend and labels
3153        ax.set_xlabel(self.grouping_column)
3154       
3155        # Manage the legend
3156        handles, labels = ax.get_legend_handles_labels()
3157        unique_labels = dict(zip(labels, handles))
3158        ax.legend(unique_labels.values(), unique_labels.keys(), loc='best')
3159
3160        if self.log_y:
3161            ax.set_yscale('log')
3162        if self.log_x:
3163            ax.set_xscale('log')
3164
3165    def _create_line_graph(self, ax):
3166        """Helper method to create a line graph with one line per group based on epochs and accuracy."""
3167        #display(self.df)
3168        # Ensure epoch is used on the x-axis and accuracy on the y-axis
3169        x_axis_column = self.data_column[0]
3170        y_axis_column = self.data_column[1]
3171
3172        if self.log_y:
3173            self.df[y_axis_column] = np.log10(self.df[y_axis_column])
3174        
3175        if self.log_x:
3176            self.df[x_axis_column] = np.log10(self.df[x_axis_column])
3177        
3178        # Set hue to the grouping column to get one line per group
3179        hue = self.grouping_column
3180
3181        # Check if the required columns exist in the DataFrame
3182        required_columns = [x_axis_column, y_axis_column, self.grouping_column]
3183        for col in required_columns:
3184            if col not in self.df.columns:
3185                raise ValueError(f"Column '{col}' not found in DataFrame.")
3186
3187        # Create the line graph with one line per group
3188        sns.lineplot(data=self.df,x=x_axis_column,y=y_axis_column,hue=hue,palette=self.sns_palette,ax=ax,marker='o',linewidth=1,markersize=6)
3189
3190        # Adjust axis labels
3191        ax.set_xlabel(f"{x_axis_column}")
3192        ax.set_ylabel(f"{y_axis_column}")
3193
3194    def _create_line_with_std_area(self, ax):
3195        """Helper method to create a line graph with shaded area representing standard deviation."""
3196
3197        x_axis_column = self.data_column[0]
3198        y_axis_column = self.data_column[1]
3199        y_axis_column_mean = f"mean_{y_axis_column}"
3200        y_axis_column_std = f"std_{y_axis_column_mean}"
3201        
3202        if self.log_y:
3203            self.df[y_axis_column] = np.log10(self.df[y_axis_column])
3204        
3205        if self.log_x:
3206            self.df[x_axis_column] = np.log10(self.df[x_axis_column])
3207
3208        # Pivot the DataFrame to get mean and std for each epoch across plates
3209        summary_df = self.df.pivot_table(index=x_axis_column,values=y_axis_column,aggfunc=['mean', 'std']).reset_index()
3210        
3211        # Flatten MultiIndex columns (result of pivoting)
3212        summary_df.columns = [x_axis_column, y_axis_column_mean, y_axis_column_std]
3213            
3214        # Plot the mean accuracy as a line
3215        sns.lineplot(data=summary_df,x=x_axis_column,y=y_axis_column_mean,ax=ax,marker='o',linewidth=1,markersize=0,color='blue',label=y_axis_column_mean)
3216
3217
3218        # Fill the area representing the standard deviation
3219        ax.fill_between(summary_df[x_axis_column],summary_df[y_axis_column_mean] - summary_df[y_axis_column_std],summary_df[y_axis_column_mean] + summary_df[y_axis_column_std],color='blue',  alpha=0.1 )
3220
3221        # Adjust axis labels
3222        ax.set_xlabel(f"{x_axis_column}")
3223        ax.set_ylabel(f"{y_axis_column}")
3224        
3225    def _create_box_plot(self, ax):
3226        """Helper method to create a box plot with consistent spacing."""
3227        # Combine grouping column and data column if needed
3228        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3229            self.df_melted['Combined Group'] = (self.df_melted[self.grouping_column].astype(str) + " - " + self.df_melted['Data Column'].astype(str))
3230            x_axis_column = 'Combined Group'
3231            hue = None
3232            ax.set_ylabel('Value')
3233        else:
3234            x_axis_column = self.grouping_column
3235            ax.set_ylabel(self.data_column[0])
3236            hue = None
3237    
3238        # Create the box plot
3239        sns.boxplot(data=self.df_melted,x=x_axis_column,y='Value',hue=self.hue,palette=self.sns_palette,ax=ax, order=self.order)
3240    
3241        # Adjust legend and labels
3242        ax.set_xlabel(self.grouping_column)
3243
3244        # Manage the legend
3245        handles, labels = ax.get_legend_handles_labels()
3246        unique_labels = dict(zip(labels, handles))
3247        ax.legend(unique_labels.values(), unique_labels.keys(), loc='best')
3248
3249        if self.log_y:
3250            ax.set_yscale('log')
3251        if self.log_x:
3252            ax.set_xscale('log')
3253

3256        # Combine grouping column and data column if needed
3257        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3258            self.df_melted['Combined Group'] = (self.df_melted[self.grouping_column].astype(str) + " - " + self.df_melted['Data Column'].astype(str))

3260            hue = None
3261            ax.set_ylabel('Value')

3264            ax.set_ylabel(self.data_column[0])
3265            hue = None
3266    
3267        # Create the violin plot
3268        sns.violinplot(data=self.df_melted,x=x_axis_column,y='Value', hue=self.hue,palette=self.sns_palette,ax=ax, order=self.order)
3269    
3270        # Adjust legend and labels
3271        ax.set_xlabel(self.grouping_column)
3272        ax.set_ylabel('Value')
3273

3284    def _create_jitter_bar_plot(self, ax):
3285        """Helper method to create a bar plot with consistent bar thickness and centered error bars."""
3286        # Flatten DataFrame: Combine grouping column and data column into one group if needed
3287        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3288            self.df_melted['Combined Group'] = (self.df_melted[self.grouping_column].astype(str) + " - " + self.df_melted['Data Column'].astype(str))
3289            x_axis_column = 'Combined Group'
3290            hue = None
3291            ax.set_ylabel('Value')

3294            ax.set_ylabel(self.data_column[0])
3295            hue = None
3296    
3297        summary_df = self.df_melted.groupby([x_axis_column]).agg(mean=('Value', 'mean'),std=('Value', 'std'),sem=('Value', 'sem')).reset_index()
3298        error_bars = summary_df[self.error_bar_type] if self.error_bar_type in ['std', 'sem'] else None
3299        sns.barplot(data=self.df_melted, x=x_axis_column, y='Value', hue=self.hue, palette=self.sns_palette, ax=ax, dodge=self.jitter_bar_dodge, ci=None, order=self.order)
3300        sns.stripplot(data=self.df_melted,x=x_axis_column,y='Value',hue=self.hue, palette=self.sns_palette, dodge=self.jitter_bar_dodge, jitter=self.bar_width, ax=ax,alpha=0.6, edgecolor='white',linewidth=1, size=16, order=self.order)
3301        
3302        # Adjust the bar width manually
3303        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3304            bars = [bar for bar in ax.patches if isinstance(bar, plt.Rectangle)]
3305            target_width = self.bar_width * 2
3306            for bar in bars:
3307                bar.set_width(target_width)  # Set new width
3308                # Center the bar on its x-coordinate
3309                bar.set_x(bar.get_x() - target_width / 2)
3310            
3311        # Adjust error bars alignment with bars
3312        #bars = [bar for bar in ax.patches if isinstance(bar, plt.Rectangle)]
3313        #for bar, (_, row) in zip(bars, summary_df.iterrows()):
3314        #    x_bar = bar.get_x() + bar.get_width() / 2
3315        #    err = row[self.error_bar_type]
3316        #    ax.errorbar(x=x_bar, y=bar.get_height(), yerr=err, fmt='none', c='black', capsize=5, lw=2)
3317    
3318        # Set legend and labels
3319        ax.set_xlabel(self.grouping_column)
3320
3321        if self.log_y:
3322            ax.set_yscale('log')
3323        if self.log_x:
3324            ax.set_xscale('log')

3326    def _create_jitter_box_plot(self, ax):
3327        """Helper method to create a box plot with consistent spacing."""
3328        # Combine grouping column and data column if needed
3329        if len(self.data_column) > 1:
3330            self.df_melted['Combined Group'] = (self.df_melted[self.grouping_column].astype(str) + " - " + self.df_melted['Data Column'].astype(str))
3331            x_axis_column = 'Combined Group'
3332            hue = None
3333            ax.set_ylabel('Value')
3334        else:
3335            x_axis_column = self.grouping_column
3336            ax.set_ylabel(self.data_column[0])
3337            hue = None

3340        sns.boxplot(data=self.df_melted,x=x_axis_column,y='Value',hue=self.hue,palette=self.sns_palette,ax=ax, order=self.order)
3341        sns.stripplot(data=self.df_melted,x=x_axis_column,y='Value',hue=self.hue, palette=self.sns_palette, dodge=self.jitter_bar_dodge, jitter=self.bar_width, ax=ax,alpha=0.6, edgecolor='white',linewidth=1, size=12, order=self.order)
3342

3345

3347        handles, labels = ax.get_legend_handles_labels()
3348        unique_labels = dict(zip(labels, handles))
3349        ax.legend(unique_labels.values(), unique_labels.keys(), loc='best')
3350

3353        if self.log_x:
3354            ax.set_xscale('log')
3355
3356    def _save_results(self):
3357        """Helper method to save the plot and results."""
3358        os.makedirs(self.output_dir, exist_ok=True)
3359        plot_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"{self.results_name}.pdf")
3360        self.fig.savefig(plot_path, bbox_inches='tight', dpi=600, transparent=True, format='pdf')
3361        results_path = os.path.join(self.output_dir, f"{self.results_name}.csv")
3362        self.results_df.to_csv(results_path, index=False)
3363        print(f"Plot saved to {plot_path}")
3364        print(f"Test results saved to {results_path}")
3365
3366    def get_results(self):
3367        """Return the results dataframe."""
3368        return self.results_df
3369    
3370    def get_figure(self):
3371        """Return the generated figure."""
3372        return self.fig
spacrGraph( df, grouping_column, data_column, graph_type='bar', summary_func='mean', order=None, colors=None, output_dir='./output', save=False, y_lim=None, log_y=False, log_x=False, error_bar_type='std', remove_outliers=False, theme='pastel', representation='object', paired=False, all_to_all=True, compare_group=None, graph_name=None) 
2508    def __init__(self, df, grouping_column, data_column, graph_type='bar', summary_func='mean', 
2509                 order=None, colors=None, output_dir='./output', save=False, y_lim=None, log_y=False,
2510                 log_x=False, error_bar_type='std', remove_outliers=False, theme='pastel', representation='object',
2511                 paired=False, all_to_all=True, compare_group=None, graph_name=None):
2512        
2513        """
2514        Class for creating grouped plots with optional statistical tests and data preprocessing.
2515        """
2516
2517        self.df = df
2518        self.grouping_column = grouping_column
2519        self.order = sorted(df[self.grouping_column].unique().tolist())
2520        self.data_column = data_column if isinstance(data_column, list) else [data_column]
2521        
2522        self.graph_type = graph_type
2523        self.summary_func = summary_func
2524        self.order = order
2525        self.colors = colors
2526        self.output_dir = output_dir
2527        self.save = save
2528        self.error_bar_type = error_bar_type
2529        self.remove_outliers = remove_outliers
2530        self.theme = theme
2531        self.representation = representation
2532        self.paired = paired
2533        self.all_to_all = all_to_all
2534        self.compare_group = compare_group
2535        self.y_lim = y_lim
2536        self.graph_name = graph_name
2537        self.log_x = log_x
2538        self.log_y = log_y
2539
2540        self.results_df = pd.DataFrame()
2541        self.sns_palette = None
2542        self.fig = None
2543
2544        self.results_name = str(self.graph_name)+'_'+str(self.data_column[0])+'_'+str(self.grouping_column)+'_'+str(self.graph_type)
2545        
2546        self._set_theme()
2547        self.raw_df = self.df.copy()
2548        self.df = self.preprocess_data()

Class for creating grouped plots with optional statistical tests and data preprocessing.
